name: Sleeping in the City
description:
Microliving is in heart of the city and walking distance to art, theater, music, and dining. Our location overlooks a hot entertainment district with a wall of windows allowing you to experience everything the city has to offer without leaving your cozy bed! Take in the beauty of the Columbus Commons Holiday lighting while sipping wine in your pj's. Enjoy the onsite dining of Hadley's Kitchen and Bar. We welcome all, but our micro unit is best for singles, couples and business travelers!

The space
The space is a private apartment with all the amenities to enjoy your stay in the city. The building is residential with full time property management on staff to assist for the duration of your stay. The building is secure and safe and in a walking neighborhood.

Guest access
Guests have access to the common area lounge, gym, laundry, and on-site dining at Hadley's and Mikey's Late Night Slice.

Other things to note
Our
neighborhood_overview: Sometimes referred to as the 4th and Main district or the Gallery District, our neighborhood is home to bars, restaurants, salons, galleries and green spaces.  Dine at Hadley's for the best burger in the city or check out Mikey's Late Night Slice for the best New York style pizza Columbus has to offer!  Pamper yourself across the street at Square One, an Aveda Salon before you head out to an upscale dinner at Side Bar.  Whatever you need, its right here!

name: Olde Towne East Historical Home
description:
This 100 year old property offers a unique Architecture and mixture of contemporary and old style.
It features 5 bedrooms and 2.5 baths; including a Master’s suite in the attic. You’ll enjoy the beautiful extra spacious bedrooms with friends, family or co-workers.
The property located in a neighborhood located in the historic East Side of Columbus, Ohio nestled between Downtown, Children’s hospital, Franklin Park, Old Oaks, and King-Lincoln.

The space
The property is approximately 2,300 ft with 5 bedrooms and 2.5 baths with both old and contemporary themes.

Guest access
When booking the entire property, you’ll have access to all rooms except the basement.

Other things to note
Parking is located right behind the property. Be sure to use the back alley to access the parking space behind the house.

name: A Zen Art Oasis - Private Guest Room
description:
Featured in Columbus Monthly, our Victorian Village Neil Avenue metropolitan home with wood floors on the first floor and classic architecture lend to the feel along with local artists artwork throughout. It is a very inviting Zen space where you will feel right at home.

The space
Private Zen like space with a queen size Baronet bed and night stand. The space includes all the necessary amenities.

Guest access
Guests are able to let themselves in at their convenience via a smart lock.

You will have access to the main house only, not the third floor attic or basement. Guests will have high speed internet access and a flatscreen TV with basic channels, a DVD player, and AppleTV. There will be an instructional binder on connecting both inside and outside of the home.

Other things to note
The patio offers a relaxing respite and the front porch has a teak glider to partake in the Neil happenings. A Workout Roo
neighborhood_overview: Victorian Village is halfway between The Ohio State University and downtown Columbus. Our house is just 3 blocks from the lively Short North, which features galleries, restaurants and unique shopping. Also, 4 blocks away is beautiful Goodale Park. On July 4th, you can watch the infamous Doo Dah Parade just down the street. You can walk down the street to watch Red, White and Boom. In the fall, the Columbus Marathon passes by our house (mile 25). Every 1st Saturday is Gallery Hop in the Short North. In June, Goodale Park is the location for Pride festivities and Comfest.  A full service grocery story is just down the street as well as many universities including CCAD, Capital, and Columbus State. Just a short drive (or 30 minute walk) to downtown Columbus!
host_about: Lover of life and travel. I have been fortunate to travel some of the world and what I've found to be the most authentic connection is to live like the locals and Airbnb delivers. ~Namaste~

name: The Gallery (Short North/OSU/Downtown)
description:
This 2nd-story private apt. is at the back of my circa 1880 home. This cheerful cozy aerie provides the comforts of home (kitchen, wifi, & cable TV). Its prime location in the Short North is in easy reach of OSU and DT on foot or by bus. I expect guests to read my entire listing before booking & printed manual upon arrival, so that expectations are clear, most especially about the vintage bath & housekeeping. This is my home--not a hotel. I welcome all who know how to be good house guests.

The space
The "Gallery" is a very small (300 sq. ft.), private 1-BR apartment attached to the back of my Victorian home on the second floor. The space consists of a partially furnished kitchen, bedroom with queen-sized bed, and bathroom sporting a vintage English-style bath (deep clawfoot tub fitted with a handheld shower head). It's extremely important for guests to realize that the bath setup does not allow for taking a shower standing up. The apartment gets wonderful light a
neighborhood_overview: Whatever your reason for traveling to Columbus, you couldn't choose a better neighborhood to stay in if you want to get acquainted quickly with this happening city. This apartment is located at the beginning of the lively strip called The Short North Arts District. From here, you can walk or bike or take a COTA bus to the OSU campus or downtown ($2 per leg). There's also a FREE bus--the CBus--that will take you up and down High Street from the Short North to the edge of German Village. But there's plenty to see and do immediately nearby in walking distance.
host_about: I was born in Kentucky but bred and educated mostly in Ohio. After 30+ years living in the Washington, DC, area, this single 62-year-old youngster is back in Columbus, OH, renovating an ancient house (not something I saw happening, LOL) and getting very interested in homesteading. I was drawn back primarily for family reasons, but also because of the enormous riches this amazing big little city has to offer. I couldn't live without art, music, books, or travel (after family, of course). My life motto, if I have one, is "Barn's burnt down. Now I can see the moon."

name: 3rd Floor Suite in Historic Home on Goodale Park
description:
Third floor one bedroom suite with king size bed, living room, and private bath located in the heart of the Short North overlooking Goodale Park. Full and exclusive use of the third floor suite with living room, kitchen, and a private bathroom.

The historic Victorian style home is conveniently located a short walk from High Street with all of its shopping, restaurants, and nightlife, as well as a short walk to the Greater Columbus Convention Center, North Market, and the Arena District.

The space
The fully renovated historic Victorian home was built in 1890 and overlooks beautiful Goodale Park, a 33 acre urban oasis steps away from the Short North.

The suite is a 3rd floor, one bedroom walk-up with a king size bed and private bathroom with shower. The fully-equipped kitchen has stainless steel appliances including a dishwasher, granite counter tops, ice maker, pots/pans, dishes, and utensils as well as a Keurig coffee machine. There i
neighborhood_overview: The Short North Arts District is the most vibrant spot in the City of Columbus and is home to over 300 exciting businesses, the majority of which are locally owned or headquartered. It has received numerous national accolades, is considered a model for urban revitalization, and is known as the art and soul of Columbus. Goodale Park is a 33 acre urban oasis steps away from the carriage house. You will find walking paths, a pond, fountain, tennis courts, picnic tables, etc.  The North Market with is also short walk away.

neighborhood_overview:

name: Urban II 3 BR 1 BA+Parking, Monthly Rates Avail!
description:
This 1200 sq ft, 3 Bed, 1 Bath duplex is part of a renovated historic 1900s duplex. Located in Weinland Park, 2 blocks from High St. and the Short North, it is a short walk to many popular bars and restaurants nearby.

Conveniently located:
1.3 mi - Columbus Convention Center
2 mi - OSU stadium
2.3 mi - Schottenstein Center
2.5 mi - Crew Stadium/Expo Center/Fair grounds
3 mi radius - all areas of interest in Downtown

Please be sure to check out our other listings nearby for larger groups!

The space
Things to Note: The apartment is over 100 years old. It has been renovated but certain parts of the home have been restored, including the wood floors. If you are searching for a commercial, hotel-like experience, this listing may not be suitable to your preferences.

No parties or events allowed.

Construction- there is currently a large building being constructed on the corner of Summit and 5th Ave
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.

The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Weinland Park, a cool, urban area on the East side of High St above 5th Ave. Weinland Park still has its edgy, up-and-coming vibe- there is a lot of construction and development still underway, real estate is hot here despite its sometimes worn look. You will see a lot of renovated homes as well as ones not-yet-touched. This is not a cookie-cutter neighborhood; it's an historic, city neighborhood. The neighborhood is home to a mix of young professionals and families and close to an elementary school. This apartment is in walking distance to High Street and N. 4th St
host_about:
We met in Japan, moved to Columbus in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and have been loving it ever since! We are both experienced travelers (25+ countries on 5 continents between us) & are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Check out our (Hidden by Airbnb) s at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers who are visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

name: Comfy home near OSU, Dublin, Worthington
description:
I'm honored you chose my home. This is my personal residence. During your stay in my entire home, I visit with friends. My home is 1,500 square feet, close to restaurants, family-friendly activities, and nightlife. You’ll love the location, comfy living, cul-de-sac neighborhood, wifi, and ENJOY A LATE 12 NOON CHECK-OUT. As last minute cancellations are costly - My place is perfect for couples, families, solo adventurers, and business travelers who are committed to their booking dates.

The space
I require guests' profiles contain a face picture, a current government issued photo ID , a current phone number and email address. Before sending inquiries, make sure your profile is updated, otherwise, I will decline your inquiry.

As the real estate saying goes, location location location. This property is ideally suited for people who don’t mind the charm of an older home (Built 1974). The property is ideally located in between Dublin and Worthington with a
neighborhood_overview: What I love about my neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors. The property is on a cul-de-sac and has very little traffic. An interesting note: if you are a bird observer, you'll enjoy a variety of birds such as Blue Jays and Cardinals living in the neighborhood. Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

description:
A 500 sq.ft. studio apartment with 10 foot ceilings and hardwood floors steps from High Street in the Short North. This is a great apartment for access to events at Ohio State, Express Live, Nationwide Arena, the Convention Center, or Goodale Park. When you come home, enjoy relaxing on the front porch. Inside work at a desk by the window, or sprawl on the couch or queen bed and watch TV.

The space
Large studio features main room with queen bed, sofa (that converts to double bed), and desk area. A decorative fireplace, 10 foot ceilings, and hardwood floors give this space a great feel. Enjoy high speed internet, and a smart TV that you can watch from the bed or the sofa.

Newly upgraded kitchen includes a full sized refrigerator, gas range, microwave, small dishwasher, coffee maker, and wall-mounted two-seat table.

Parking is available in a parking lot behind the building. Just let us know how many cars your group will have.

Gues
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy Northstar Cafe just around the corner for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner. If you're into tacos, Condado is a fun spot. Mouton is a lovely choice for craft cocktails, and if caffeine is your need One Line Coffee shop is a great choice.

The Short North has it all - from great events in Goodale Park and at the Convention Center, to restaurants, bars, coffee shops, galleries, and local shops. This apartment puts you in the heart of the neighborhood.

Convention Center (0.7mi)

OSU (Thompson Library 1.4mi) (Wexner Medical Center 1.3mi) (Ohio Stadium “Horseshoe” 1.7mi)

host_about:

It has received numerous national accolades, is considered a model for urban revitalization, and is known as the art and soul of Columbus.

Goodale Park is a 33 acre urban oasis steps away from the carriage house. You will find walking paths, a pond, fountain, tennis courts, picnic tables, etc.

description:
My home is located in the heart of Clintonville on a beautiful tree-lined street. It is just north of OSU campus (2.4 miles to Ohio Stadium) and takes only a couple minutes to drive to I-71, SR315, Riverside Hospital, Mapfre Stadium, and about 10 min to the Schottenstein Center. It is within a short walk to the Farmer's Market, Starbucks, Whetstone Library, Park of Roses, Olentangy Trail, as well as many shops and restaurants. It is a GREAT location in a safe Columbus neighborhood!

The space
This listing is for the spacious basement with a private entrance. It includes one queen-sized bed, a dresser to store your clothing, and a full private bathroom. Recent upgrades include a SmartTV compatible with your subscription to Netflix, Hulu, Prime Video, etc. New renovations include a kitchenette, a sitting room behind the barn door, new drywall, painting, new carpeting (please take your shoes off at entrance!), new loveseat, and new ottoman.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview:
The house is on a beautiful, tree-lined street located in the heart of Clintonville. It is just a couple of minutes from I-71, SR315, Riverside Hospital, Schottenstein Center, Mapfre Stadium, and OSU campus. Starbucks is just a block away, as is the Clintonville Farmers' Market, which is open on Saturday mornings in the summer and fall. Whetstone Park, home to the library, the Park of Roses, fields, woods, tennis, and a playground is within walking distance. The 13-mile Olentangy River Trail goes through the park and connects downtown Columbus to Worthington.

I would be glad to answer any further questions you may have about the neighborhood, house or its location.

Megan and I are young entrepreneurial professionals with an adventurous outlook on life! Our weeks typically include our professional careers, taking care of our two loveable dogs, triathlons and endurance racing, great restaurants, craft beers and cocktails, movies, and friends and family.

We love international travel and can't say no to a tropical destination. We utilize Airbnb when we travel as well and love having guests.

name: Peaceful Room in Devonshire
description:
Close to I-71 and I-270, our home is good for solo adventurers and business travelers.
Located in a safe and quiet residential neighborhood on the Northside of Columbus, it is at the center of major points of attraction: 7 mi. from Polaris Mall or Ohio State Fairgrounds, 8 mi. from Easton Mall or OSU, 10 mi. from Greyhound station, 14 mi. from the Airport, and just 3 mi. from Kroger.
If you must eat healthy, no problem! Our local health food store and diner, Raisin Rack, is just 2 miles away.

The space
Located on the 2nd floor, this little room is peaceful, inviting, and comfortable.
Enjoy the use of your own Coffee machine ~ Choice of teas ~ your own refrigerator, space Air Conditioner or heater. A microwave is shared with another guest, if any.
The front porch is a peaceful little place to sit - or work - on sunny or drizzling days.

Other things to note
Due to the coronavirus, we’re taking extra care to disinfect fr
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is great for walking and our location is close to shopping or restaurants with just a short drive.
host_about:
Hello and welcome to Columbus, Ohio! 

My husband is from Japan, an amateur radio lover, chigiri-e artist, sushi chef, and excellent cook. I grew up in a tiny village of the French Alps, enjoy nature, a good movie, and a walk in the park together with my hubby. While taking care of our family, children, and grandchildren, we keep expanding our friendship circle.  

And I am so grateful to our Airbnb community who is bringing such a diverse group of travelers to our doorstep including those who are coming for business, conferences, exhibitions, visiting relatives, nurses and students needing a comfortable bed after a long day of work or training, and even people who are here to relocate. 

We’re friendly and try to provide our guests with what we appreciate when we are away from home – a relaxing, peaceful, and loving place for a refreshing night rest.

Close to coffee, restaurants and shops on High St. Recent overhaul of this lovely 950 sf getaway included new carpet, high quality furniture and fabulous bedrooms. This is a quiet retreat with great wifi, Apple TV, washer/dryer, cozy private courtyard and stocked kitchen.

The space
The Condo: 950 sq ft. two story condo features a very welcoming great room with a super large coffee table surrounded by two lovely comfy couches, making for a great space for casual meals, playing board games, watching Netflix on our 42 inch LG flatscreen TV or listening to music on our bluetooth sound bar.

THE KITCHEN is stocked with the basics including a "welcome home" drink in the fridge. The table is a large sturdy farm style table with plenty of room for four or more. There is great coffee and tea in the cabine
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is steps from the bike path where you can enjoy a spin up to Worthington or down to campus (bike provided!). It's also a lovely place for a morning run or a late evening stroll by the river. Walk 1/4 mile up the path and visit Como Park.

Clintonville has so many wonderful restaurants and attractions an easy walk or ride from the condo. Campus, short north and downtown Columbus are easily accessible and a short bike or uber ride away.

description:

The space

The first floor has a covered, outdoor rear porch with seating area, a large kitchen with island and eat in dining nook. The living area has WIFI & cable TV and plenty of seating (including a queen sleeper sofa)! The dining room has a large table that can accommodate 10-12 guests. Additionally, there is a small bedroom with twin bunkbeds, desk and ful
neighborhood_overview: Old North Columbus is a neighborhood located just north of the Ohio State University in Columbus, Ohio. It was founded in 1847 where, at the time, it was a stand-alone city out of the confines of Columbus until it was incorporated into the City of Columbus in 1871. In its early years the city was a popular stagecoach stop with people traveling from Worthington to Columbus. Today Old North Columbus is popular for its local music and its unique "untouched architecture" which is reminiscent of its old roots.

description:
Stay in the heart of Columbus surrounded by beautiful parks. This modern 2-bedroom townhouse sleeps 7; perfect for a family or business trip. Just steps from Franklin Park, and Old Town East, your group will love being so close to the best that Columbus has to offer. Hop on a bus, or Uber and you are a few minutes from downtown, German Village and the Short North for eclectic shopping and dinning. Easy access to OSU, the CMH Airport, Easton Towne Center and Capital University.

The space
The first floor has a large living room, and dinning room that is open to a fully functional kitchen with new appliances. The second floor boast a large master bedroom with a view of the park and courtyard (queen bed and couch). The second bedroom has a queen bedroom and view of the park as well.

Guest access
Guests will be able to access the entire house except the basement. There is also a common space in the front main courtyard that is used by all of the
neighborhood_overview: The best part about our hideaway is the Franklin Park Conservatory right across  the street, as well as the park. A few blocks east on Broad, you'll find Wolfe Park and tennis courts. Panera Bread is down the street about a mile. Spend an afternoon or evening on Main Street in Bexley, home of Capital University. Take in a movie at the Drexel Theater, visit Guiseppe's Italian Bistro, Aab India, Cafe Instanbul, Zen Cha Tea Salon, or any number of ice cream and pizza parlors. The Grain and Grape has an excellent choice of wines and beers, and there are several nail salons and banks. Pick up a few groceries at Kroger or Giant Eagle (which also boasts a restaurant at the top called The Table).
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

neighborhood_overview:
Victorian Village, which runs along Neil Avenue south of The Ohio State University and northwest of downtown Columbus, is one of central Ohio’s cores of fine residential architecture. The area is known for its Victorian houses, which were built when a streetcar line first ran along Neil Avenue around 1900.

Victorian Village is directly west of the well known Short North area of Columbus. Some of the most celebrated spots to eat and drink in Columbus are in the Short North Arts District, which is gaining recognition as a dining destination. This portion of High Street is filled with boutiques, art galleries, coffee houses, restaurants, and bars.

name: Enjoy my master guest bedroom
description:
This is a shared listing with me in my home. Close to restaurants, family-friendly activities, and nightlife. You’ll love my place because of the location, comfy living, cul-de-sac neighborhood, wifi, and there's a grill in the fenced backyard. As last minute cancellations are costly - My place is perfect for couples, families, solo adventurers, and business travelers who are committed to their booking dates. I welcome all guests from various backgrounds - I make a great conversationalist.

The space
As the real estate saying goes, location location location. The property is ideally located in between Dublin and Worthington. Minutes from restaurants, entertainment and the business sectors of both communities. Simply take 315 South for a quick ride to downtown Columbus. Situated in a cul-de-sac the property enjoys a quiet, mature neighborhood. The property is a three level split with seven steps upstairs or six steps down to the lower level of the home. When you en
neighborhood_overview: What I love about my neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors. The property is on a cul-de-sac and has very little traffic. An interesting note: if you are a bird observer, you'll enjoy a variety of birds such as Blue Jays and Cardinals living in the neighborhood. Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

We offer an apartment at cost effective prices for small and large groups. The quote breakdown shows the additional guest fe
neighborhood_overview:
The duplex is located near Iuka Ravine on N. 4th St. We have lived here in the past and would again! There is a mix of musicians, professors, students, and working professionals live in the area. There are bus stops nearby and a nice park, the ravine, down the hill (about a one minute walking distance) from the house.

The apartment is within walking distance (15 mins or so) to Ohio State University.

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads such as High Street, Summit, and 5th Ave.
host_about:
We met in Japan, moved to Columbus in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and have been loving it ever since! We are both experienced travelers (25+ countries on 5 continents between us) & are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Check out our (Hidden by Airbnb) s at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers who are visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is a pioneer in urban revitalization. The Short North Arts District is the most vibrant spot in the City of Columbus and is home to over 300 exciting businesses, the majority of which are locally owned or headquartered. It has received numerous national accolades, is considered a model for urban revitalization, and is known as the art and soul of Columbus.

Directly east of High Street is Italian Village. New energy is transforming this spot into a nightlife hub. Little Rock hosts live music, Seventh Son Brewing uses its creative energy to craft category-busting beers, and Hoof Hearted Brewing combines heavy-hitting brews with a thoroughly mod taproom. In the daylight hours, check out The Market Italian Village for upscale picnic supplies and delicious pizzas, or the sunlight-drenched Fox in the Snow Cafe for an outstanding latte

name: Art at 185 German Village
description:
Welcome to Art at 185, our studio apartment in the heart of German Village. This space has been created for guests to enjoy not only a stay in Historic German Village but also a display of local art, currently featuring works from Open Door Art Gallery, located in Grandview. (URL HIDDEN) Once a working art studio has now been turned into a cozy studio apartment walking distance from the fabulous restaurants in German Village, downtown Columbus and Children's Hospital.

The space
Art at 185 is bigger and better than it looks, it is quite spacious and you will not want to “judge the book by the cover .” This space was built in 1890’s and once a buggy/car mechanic garage . Currently the studio showcases original art created by Columbus artists. Founded in 2007, Open Door Art Studio empowers artists with disabilities to work with professional creative mentors in an environment of mutual respect and creative freedom. I also have several of my 92 year old father’s han
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of historic German Village, a quiet neighborhood on the southern edge of downtown Columbus.  This quaint community allows you to walk to multiple restaurants, coffee shops, gift stores and park.
host_about: As a 37 year resident of Columbus Ohio and graduate of The Ohio State University,  I have seen how this amazing city has grown and changed. As empty nesters,  we recently moved back to German Village where my husband and I met and lived when we were first married. We raised our children in Upper Arlington and are now enjoying all The Village and city life has to offer . I love to stay physically active, enjoy the arts, the mountains of Montana, the heat of Austin and of course The Ohio State University.

neighborhood_overview:
ABOUT GERMAN VILLAGE

You are in one of the best parts of Columbus, Ohio—beautiful and historic German Village. There is so much to see and do and most of the area is pedestrian friendly.

We have our favorite eateries including Barcelona, Sycamore Café, Brown Bag Deli, Winans, Pistachio Vera, Taco Tuesday at The Kitchen, Lindey’s, Katzinger’s, G Michaels, Skillet, Village Coney, Schmidt's, Thurmans, Fox in the Snow, Antiques on High (brewery), Alpine, Smoked on High BBQ….. Check out German Village Society for details.

For fitness options, there is a Snap Fitness facility on Third Ave and Schiller Rec Center in the Park (both are fee-based).

Laundromat is available a block away.

One bedroom and one bathroom

Huge Apartment in Downtown Columbus.

Everything you need: Free Parking Space. 65in smart Apple TV and Netflix. Super fast internet. Brand new furniture. Full kitchen and new appliances. iMac. Vinyl records. Unique paintings. Strong central AC/heating. Washer/Dryer.

Perfect Location: Near The Short North. Southern Theatre, Ohio Theatre and Columbus Commons. German Village and the Brewery District are all next door!

Ideal for a couple or have the entire place to yourself. No parties permitted.

The space
A deeply cleaned, recently remodeled 1,400 sq. foot apartment with 15 foot living room ceilings, brand new furniture, and appliances.

neighborhood_overview: Perfectly located in downtown Columbus above a quiet, Irish restaurant called Dempsy's, near the Riverfront parks, Southern Theatre, Ohio Theatre, COSI science center, and bar/restaurants like The Walrus, 16-bit Arcade, Sidebar, Mikey's Late Night Slice, Winan's, Condado, and The GOAT, right around the corner. There are plenty of speak easy's and cocktail bars in German Village, including some of the finest dining in town like Barcelona, Lindy's, G. Michael's, Pistacio Vera, and Rockmill Tavern.
host_about:
During college, I spent two years on the road as a musician all around the US and Europe. Throughout my travels, I founded a few businesses and non-profits and made Columbus my home. I’m also currently a Senior Management Consultant. I travel internationally for technology projects, speak at conferences, and add cultural elements to city transformation initiatives.

As a host, I enjoy creating the kind of environment that I would want to have for myself as a traveler — a place that’s modern, comfortable, equipped with new and working amenities, and in the heart of downtown, near bars, restaurants, theaters, and conferences, yet still restful and peaceful.

Our apartment offers 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, full kitchen, and private parking in the heart of Victorian Village just 1/3 mile from High Street and the Short North! Close enough to enjoy everything on High Street but just far enough to enjoy the neighborhood feel of Victorian Village! You are less than a mile south from OSU Campus, less than a mile north from the Columbus Convention Center, and 1/3 mile from all of the best bars and restaurants Columbus has to offer!

The space
Our house offers 2 bedrooms (each with memory foam queen beds), 1 bathroom, full kitchen, and 2 private parking spots in the heart of Victorian Village. The common space has a futon and a sofa with a pull out queen size bed. We also offer an air mattress for your convenience. The house has been newly furnished with all new memory foam mattresses and furnishings. The living room has a brand new 50 inch tv with cable. The dining room has a large table with seating for 6.

Guest a
neighborhood_overview: Victorian Village, which runs along Neil Avenue south of The Ohio State University and northwest of downtown Columbus, is one of central Ohio’s cores of fine residential architecture. The area is known for its Victorian houses, which were built when a streetcar line first ran along Neil Avenue around 1900. Victorian Village is directly west of the well known Short North area of Columbus. Some of the most celebrated spots to eat and drink in Columbus are in the Short North Arts District, which is gaining recognition as a dining destination. This portion of High Street is filled with boutiques, art galleries, coffee houses, restaurants, and bars.

Perfect “feels-like-home” 2-story, 2-bedroom townhouse with "3rd Bedroom" finished basement. Fully updated bathroom, which includes bathtub & dual granite vanity-sinks. All beds are memory foam mattresses with comfy sheets, lots of pillows, and a desk in each room. The finished basement has a memory-foam sofa bed. Full kitchen with granite counters, new cherry cabinets, and all-stainless appliances. Superfast 100MB secure WiFi, along with Cable, Netflix & HBO+. Absolutely pristine-clean.

The space
This space is owned and kept by Will, an AirBnB "Superhost". Superhost status is an award from AirBnB only given to experienced hosts who provide extraordinary experiences for their guests. Expect and count on getting nothing but the best.

Please note: this is a townhouse and has stairs.

Guest access
This is your space - all of it! Private, Private, Private!

neighborhood_overview:
Located just off Sawmill Road in the northwest part of Columbus (Dublin Suburb), the Townhouse is about a 20 minutes drive from the airport or to downtown/Short North.

Everything you need for food or shopping is just minutes away, including Starbucks, Fresh Thyme Farmer's Market, and Piada Italian Street food, as well as Chick-fil-a and Chipolte! If you wake up early, Krispy Kreme Doughnuts are being made nearby hot and fresh every morning. And, if you forgot anything, a 24-hour Walmart Superstore is just a few blocks away with everything under one roof.

For those looking to get a workout in during your stay, there is a huge Lifetime Fitness Center, as well as an Orange Theory Fitness Studio, just 2 blocks away.

name: Great Amenities @ Shumacher Place & German Village
description:
Cozy bungalow style house with modern finishes and private yard with a great porch to sit and relax during the day or at night. Feel at home in the Historical Schumacher & German Village area within walking distance to Children's Hospital, Downtown & many popular shops & restaurants. While you have access to the whole home I live on premises in the lower level basement apartment, which has a separate entrance in the back from the rest of the house and shares a small foyer. You have total privacy

The space
This has a queen size bed and desk in the larger room and a queen in the smaller room that will sleep two. The living room has an Ikea sofa bed that's between a full and Queen and can sleep 2. There is also a queen size air mattress available. Living room also has electric fireplace(this is not a real fireplace) and smart Wi-Fi TV and streaming services from YouTube live TV, and Amazon Video. There is Amazon Alexa to help you with directions or to listen to you
neighborhood_overview: This Is in the Historical Shumacher place and German Village area and is within walking distance from Children's Hospital, Downtown Columbus and many popular shops and restaurants. Just a 5 min. Walk to two popular Eateries the Sycamore and Plank's. The pizza at Plank's is very popular among the locals. This is a very safe area and I have not had any issues. There is a Giant Eagle grocery near by and as mentioned before some of the most popular Bars and Restaurant's near by.
host_about:
I was born In Missouri but grew up in Columbus Ohio since I was an infant. I'm a New Years baby and was actually the first of the year in the town I was born in. I served in the Military back in the late 80's and early 90's. I am easy going and like to stay active, exercise and eat healthy. My favorite activity is shooting pool. I'm fascinated by Science and Technology. I Like to listen to many different styles of music but my favorite is Classic rock. My favorite destination has to be anywhere there's palm trees and white sandy beaches but i do like the outdoors and love different types of climates. 
I hope to be a great host and will treat you like i would expect to be treated. I did spend a great deal of my life working in the service industry and know what it takes to provide exceptional service.

name: Family friendly, clean, restful stay
description:
Clean and peaceful stay on the south side of Columbus. Our place is a 10 minute drive to downtown, a 5 minute walk to the bus station on South Parsons Ave. (Bus line #8 will take you downtown in 15 minutes), a 5 minute drive to Scioto Downs raceway, and a 2 minute drive to the I-270 outerbelt. It takes about 15-20 minutes to get to or from Columbus John Glenn International Airport. We have free high-speed internet and a washer and a dryer for a small fee.

The space
Our place isn't in downtown, but it is close and easily-accessible to all the major attractions of Columbus. Further, our proximity to the highway allows you to travel around the central Ohio area rather easily. We live in a peaceful and safe neighborhood on the south side conveniently (2-5 minutes) to shopping and restaurants. Within walking distance is a nice recreation center and park which has a half mile track. Our three bedroom bi-level house is home to my wife, son, and I as well as one roommate
neighborhood_overview: Bunch restaurants close by.
host_about: I'm an easy-going guy who enjoys traveling and exploring this big world. My wife and I love hosting and sharing experiences with our guests. Together we have been to many countries around the world and hope to travel to many more. When you come to our home we can show you around town or leave you to your own. We just hope you have an enjoyable and peaceful stay!

name: Comfy home minutes from Downtown
description:
I'm honored you chose my property. During your stay, you'll enjoy a spacious 1,100 square feet apartment, close to restaurants, family-friendly activities, and a 5 minute drive downtown. You’ll love the proximity to downtown, comfy living, in an up and coming neighborhood that is being gentrified. As last minute cancellations are costly - My place is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers who are committed to their booking dates.

The space
I require a profile contain a face picture, a current government issued photo ID , a current phone number and email address. Before sending inquiries, make sure your profile is updated, otherwise, I will decline your inquiry.

The property is ideally located 5 minutes from COSI and Downtown Columbus - only a 8 minute drive to the Convention Center. Minutes from restaurants, entertainment and the business sectors. Simply take either Town or Broad Street East for a quick 5 minute ride to downtown
neighborhood_overview:
What I love about the neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors and it's proximity to the downtown area. Franklinton is an old community. The local city and state government are spending millions gentrifying this neighborhood.
It is 5 minutes from Downtown/Arena District. (Nationwide Arena, Express Live, North Market), 9 minutes from the infamous Short North. The "art & soul" of Columbus, the Short North is a vibrant cultural and small business community. Park your car along Goodale Park on Buttles Ave for free and gallery hop, thrift or have dinner/drinks at just about any type of bar. 8 minutes away from the Greater Convention Center.

Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

It has been completely remodeled, with high efficiency HVAC, windows, appliances and flooring. We design for the urban dweller, with quick downtown access.

The space
This top floor unit is bright and airy. Lots of windows provide sunshine during the day. Everything has been touched from lighting to flooring. The desk workspace is private and enable more than one person to work comfortably. Whether you want to stay in and watch netflix, or go out and enjoy what Co

And for those who want the art scene, the Short North is a short inexpensive Uber ride away.
host_about: I am a developer who has a passion for creating new urban experiences in areas that are developing and close to the core of what's happening in the city. I take my job with me and enjoy the benefits of experiencing new living environments while working a job I love!  I look forward to sharing my developed properties with the Short Stay community.

host_about:
I am an African American Male, originally from Chicago,  Illinois with a large family of 2 aunts & 6 uncles that primarily live in Chicago,  but one uncle lives n in New Orleans.  Moved to northwest Maryland outside of Baltimore, MD and went to a public high school,  Fort Hill High School before transferring and graduating from Bishop Walsh Catholic High School.  Attending Penn State University playing football & basketball with a degree in Sports Management / Sports Law with a double minor in Legal Environment of Business and Exercise & Sports Science.  I determined to be Jerry Maguire (my favorite movie)  before the movie came out.  I've been a high school football coach,  NCAA football coach,  NFL Coach for 10 years,  and a sports agent for football & basketball.  I was formerly a Director of Marketing & Business Development  a medium-sized Law Firm in Philadelphia,  as well as Marketing Consultant for 3 BIG Four Accounting Firms at Grant Thornton,  KPMG, and Deloitte. I've run my own business 20+ years as a sports agent,  business manager, and marketing consultant for small businesses. 

I have two beautiful boys ages 9 & 6 years old (very active). My mother is a retired Vice President of a University and my brother is also a former NCAA football player from Penn State & Indiana University of Pennsylvania. My Italian family I grew up with,  owns the best bakery in Maryland at Caporales Bakery for over 100 years with the best Pepperoni Rolls and Pizza Rolls on the world (just saying).

I have been cooking since I was 10 years old and love to cook.  I am a self-titled  handyman, DIY type of guy,  but I know my limitations and can't take on everything but I try first to assess before delegating. I don't drink alcohol,  smoke, no drugs.  I goto weekly networking events for business and to socialize. I haven't been to all 50 states as of yet (that's a goal), but I have been overseas several times.

description:

neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

The City of Columbus is focusing on creating a new Short North style neigh

name: Charming Clintonville Cottage
description:
Cozy vintage cottage in South Clintonville, steps to the bike path in one direction, High St and shops, restaurants, and bars in the other.

The whole 1st floor, with 2 bedrooms, dining and living room, and kitchen and bath is available to spread out and make yourself at home. I’ll sometimes be home, mostly hanging out upstairs, and sometimes I’ll be out of town. The bathroom and kitchen are shared when I’m home.

Our home is 110 years old, with all the quirks and charms that come with it!

The space
Our eclectic bohemian home is in one of Columbus’ older neighborhoods, on a quaint brick lined street in Clintonville. Built in 1907, it’s unusual in its- mostly- original design, with a quirk of no hallways, and each room having a minimum of two doorways. There are even two front doors, confusing UPS drivers for a few generations now!

We have a front porch and back yard and garden to enjoy during the warmer months. Inside, there’s a co
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood, Clintonville, is one of C-bus’ jewels. Just north of the University area, the neighborhood is full of vintage homes, built between 1900 and the 1930s. Always in the top 3 of best places to live and hang out in Columbus, it’s progressive, walkable, and safe. Clintonville has lots of restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, and bars, along with shops of all kinds, many of which are within a few block walk of our home. Our home is exactly halfway between High St, with all the stops and places to eat and drink, and the Olentangy Bike Trail, which takes you from downtown to the south, to Worthington, a few miles to the north, and several parks along the way.

High St is Columbus’ main thoroughfare, and it can take you pretty much anywhere you need to go. Busses are frequent and inexpensive, and Uber or Lyft can take you downtown, OSU, or the Short North in just a few minutes.
host_about:
Introvert who loves people. Liker of books, food, sharing opinions, pretty things, and bad music.

When you’re staying with me, sometimes I’ll be home but staying out of your way, and sometimes I’ll be traveling for work. I’m a Certified Tourism Ambassador for Columbus, so I’m very happy to share recommendations for places to while you’re spending time in C-bus.

If I’m traveling, I’ll be looking for a place to relax after seeing your town, and while we will surely find you delightful we will largely be seeking alone time.

neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

Freshly updated studio apartment with a private outside entrance, located just between the Short North and The Ohio State University! host_about:
I moved back to Ohio about four years ago to pursue my horse showing passion. 
Before jumping back into horse showing, I began a house hunt. 
After a year of trying to find the perfect house, I bought this little fixer upper. I spent the following year renovating it from top to bottom. It was a great challenge which created many memories. I am very proud of the home my family and I created which is why I am excited to share it with you all while I am off showing horses.

We are also 1.3 miles from the Hollywood Casino and about 14 minutes from the OSU Stadium.

The space

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a work in progress.  Many are like us and bought their homes to redo.
host_about:
My husband and I moved to Columbus from NJ to be with our grandchildren a few years ago.  We bought our house as a rehab and have been working on it since.  This is a new experience for us but we have enjoyed it.

We are both originally from the Midwest, my husband was born in Kansas and grew up in Illinois.  I was born and grew up in Michigan.  We lived in Colorado for 13 years before moving to NJ and have loved all the places we have lived.  

We have travelled to many parts of the world (Mexico, Israel, Philippines, Korea, Europe) and enjoyed the different cultures as well as made many new friends.  I think this is one of the reasons we love Columbus.  There are so many different cultures here as well as their cuisines which I love to try. We find Columbus offers many of the experiences of a larger city but love the smaller size.

name: Oasis in the City (Near Bexley)
description:
Nestled in Columbus' east side, our home sits on half an acre of land amidst a residential locale of long term residents. It is ideally located one minute from the I-70 highway on one of the main north/south arteries in the city. It sits back from the street allowing for ample parking and clear passage to and from the road. It is a 5 mile drive to downtown, 5 mile direct commute to the airport, and minutes away from convenient stores, restaurants, suburbs, and many of Columbus' popular venues.

The space
Our home is a 1000 sq ft ranch with an open layout in which the living room, dining room, and kitchen are closely shared spaces. The bathroom and bedrooms are separated from that space by a short hallway for privacy. The front yard and particularly the backyard offer ample areas for light recreation and relaxation. The backyard includes a patio with a table and chairs to unwind. The backyard grass is a unique, extra soft type that will encourage guests to take off
neighborhood_overview: In two different directions, our location is ideally located about 1 mile from I-70 highway. It is a straight shot to Columbus International Airport. It is 1 mile from the suburb of Bexley, a high-end community with cozy ambiance including many popular restaurants like Starbucks, Chipotle, Piada, Boston Market, Penn Station and Jersey Mike's subs, Panera Bread, as well as other local favorites such as Columbus' own Donatos Pizza, Cafe Instabul, C'est Si Bon Cafe featuring a diverse selection of crepes, Rubino's extra thin crust pizza, Rusty Bucket Restaurant and Tavern, Johnson's and Grater's ice cream shops, and more! One of our major grocery stores, Giant Eagle Marketplace, sits right across from the suburb's private college campus of Capital University- All of that atmosphere just one mile away! The neighborhoods in front and behind our home are quiet and residential. Two blocks behind the house is a small, private high school so guests may hear distant cheers and whistles, and see
host_about: OSU Buckeye alumni born and raised in Cbus, we are a husband and wife team who  enjoy people and cultures, traveling, and pursuing our dreams together. Columbus has so much to offer, and we desire to share our city and make our guests feel at home while in our abode.

neighborhood_overview:

name: German Village Weekend Retreat on Schiller Park
description:
Built in 1870, our home is located across from Schiller Park in the heart of German Village, just minutes from the best restaurants and book shops in Columbus.

The house is very comfortable but its 9 ft ceilings make it feel grand! Three living spaces occupy the main floor including a cook's kitchen/dining area opening out onto the garden patio.

The walled garden is designed as a series of outdoor rooms & the attached carport serves as an 'al dente' covered dining room.

Enjoy!

The space
We are only the 3rd owners of this original German Village home. It is very comfortable and unique! In addition to the 9 ft ceilings, we have 3 working fireplaces, making it really comfortable and cozy! Just steps from Schiller Park, Jeni’s Ice Cream and the Brown Bag Deli...a great location!

Guest access
You’ll have full access to all parts of the house so we hope you'll make youself comfortable! We love to cook an
neighborhood_overview: German Village is an historic neighborhood developed in the mid-1800's by German immigrants who moved to Columbus to work in the breweries along the river, now known as the Brewery District.  Brick streets are lined with brick cottages and larger Italianate and Queen Anne houses, intermingled with great restaurants and shops.  Schiller Park is the heart and soul of German Village with a recreation center, public gardens, tennis courts, a ball field and an outdoor amphitheater for summer plays.

neighborhood_overview:
Stretching north from Ohio State to Worthington, Clintonville is a large neighborhood with many attractions, from the Park of Roses to the independently owned retail shops and restaurants that line High Street. Standout shops include modern decor purveyor Elm and Iron, fabric mecca Sew to Speak and all-locally made Wholly Craft.

During warmer months, people flock to the Clintonville Farmers Market to get fresh produce and to the Olentangy River recreational trail to hike and bike. Arts venues like Wild Goose Creative and Studio 35 provide cultural opportunities year-round.

Start your day with a cup of coffee at Cup O' Joe or Crimson Cup, both on the Columbus Coffee Trail. Dining choices veer toward farm-to-table, with Acre, Harvest Pizzeria, The Crest Gastropub and Angry Bear Kitchen as standouts. Get in line for world-class barbecue at the Ray Ray’s Hog Pit truck, at live music hotspot Ace of Cups.

Learn some new skills amid a gorgeous setting at Th

I work full-time for an engineering company doing survey work. I love the fact that I can be hospitable and host people from all around the world even while having a full-time Job. 

I'm big into fitness, reading, movies, and I'm always trying to reach bigger goals.
One of my favorite things to do is go to the movies and watch a good comedy, the seats in the Easton AMC theater are amazing!

Both beds in upstairs bedrooms are Memory-foam with quality, comfy sheets, lots of pillows, and a desk in each room. The finished basement has a double-size sofa bed, and we can also add a queen-sized inflatable bed if needed. Full kitchen with eating area. Superfast 100MB secure WiFi, along with Cable and Netflix. Absolutely pristine-clean.

The space
This space is owned and kept by Will, an AirBnB "Superhost". Superhost status is an award from AirBnB only given to experienced hosts who provide extraordinary experiences for their guests. Expect and count on getting nothing but the best.

Please note: this is a townhouse and has stairs.

Guest access
This is your space - all of it! Private, Private, Private!

neighborhood_overview:
Located just off Sawmill Road in the northwest part of Columbus (Dublin Suburb), the Townhouse is about a 20 minutes drive from the airport or to downtown/Short North.

Everything you need for food or shopping is just minutes away, including Starbucks, Fresh Thyme Farmer's Market, and Piada Italian Street food, as well as Chick-fil-a and Chipolte! If you wake up early, Krispy Kreme Doughnuts are being made nearby hot and fresh every morning. And, if you forgot anything, a 24-hour Walmart Superstore is just a few blocks away with everything under one roof.

For those looking to get a workout in during your stay, there is a huge Lifetime Fitness Center, as well as an Orange Theory Fitness Studio, just 2 blocks away.

host_about:
Hello! 
My name is Christy, I'm your Host.
My Daughter Emily & I have been Super Hosts since early 2018. 
We take pride in making sure our home is spotless & our Guests are comfortable!  
We understand how expensive hotels can be. Whether you're traveling for work or pleasure, this is a cozy place to rest your head.

We even have a Caretaker (Brian) that will help you with anything you need around our home. 
He is very friendly (but values your privacy), he really knows Columbus!  If you have any questions or need anything, just call/text him. He lives in the apt. on the lower level & has a completely separate entrance.  
He works most nights & is only available during the day (9am-8pm). 
Both of our phone #'s are in the welcome letter on kitchen counter. Call or text anytime. 

We are a Military family & welcome Military families to stay with us!

We look forward to meeting you!

Bright and industrial 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom private second floor apartment located steps from Grandview Avenue. Check out the local cafes, bars and even the indoor glow in the dark Putt-Putt golf (one of my favorites). You are just minutes away from Downtown Columbus, COSI, Nationwide Arena, The Schottenstein Center, Convention Center, the Arena District and most importantly the ‘Shoe. Everything you could want is within walking distance or a short bus ride or Uber away.

The space
Relax in this adorable apartment with comfortable furnishings and high speed internet. The bathroom was remodel in March 2020 and a new stove was installed in December 2019. This apartment does not have Cable but does have an antenna that provides basic local channels. There is also an Apple TV, but you must have your own log in information for streaming services.

Relax in the comfortable Queen size Sleep Number Bed! Trust me, once you find your number it will be the best

name: Judge’s Mansion Antique Modern Apartment
description:
Located in the historic Judge’s Mansion in Olde Towne East, this spacious guest apartment is located on the 3rd floor of the Mansion. Your private suite includes a bedroom, living room, kitchen, and bath. There's plenty of open space to spread out or share with a travel companion. Tastefully designed and thoughtfully laid out to create a balance of comfort and thought provoking, Instagram-able, photo ready space for you to enjoy during your stay in Columbus.

The space
Judge’s Mansion was built for Judge Edmond Bothwell Dillon in the late 1800s in historic Olde Towne East. The building has since been converted into several private apartments but still remains home to us. We welcome you into our home and hope you love the large windows, tall ceilings, grand staircase, and Victorian character as much as we do. Our home features several apartments of varying sizes and decor. The Antique Modern Apartment featured in this listing is a 1-bedroom apartment with a queen b
neighborhood_overview:
Olde Towne East is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Columbus and is currently undergoing rapid revitalization. The neighborhood has over 1,000 homes, some as old as the 1830s, and more than 50 architectural styles as a result of its history. Some homes have been restored and others remain untouched as reminders of eras that have gone before. Our street and surrounding streets are some of the safest blocks in Columbus! For more information about the neighborhood, check out crime heat maps online, g@@gle map view or search, and learn a little bit more about the history of the community!

Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at local favorite Carabar. On Oak Street, try breakfast at vegan-friendly The Angry Baker, lunch at the Olde Towne Tavern and dinner and a huge beer list at Yellow Brick Pizza. F

Located in Olde Towne East, Columbus, Ohio, we are the premier Guest House of the Near East Side (Olde Towne East, Franklin Park, King Lincoln, Woodland Park) offering six apartments and two queen en suites.  In operation since 2015, we host over 100 guests per year. Will you consider being one?  

Connect with us @judgesmansion on IG 

Stay for a night or three, shoot on location here, or meet up with friends.  #judgesmansion #judgesmansiondreams

neighborhood_overview:
German Village is a historic neighborhood just south of downtown Columbus, OH. Initially platted in 1814 in Columbus' South End, German Village was generally developed between years 1840 and 1914. It was settled largely by German immigrants in the mid-1800s. German descendants at one time comprised as much as one-third of the population of Columbus. Restoration began in 1959 and the Historic District was established in 1963. German Village was the FIRST historic district in the U.S. and it remains a model for all that came after. In the year 1974, German Village joined the Historic Register. Today, more than 1,600 preservations have been completed.

Purdy Haus dates to at least the year 1910 when it was occupied by a woodworker/barber George C. McMillin. Nearby homes date between years 1884 and 1888, so it may be older.

Walk everywhere - sidewalks are wide - people are warm - parks and restaurants are plentiful! And German Village is central to everything
host_about: Professional female half of the household; mom, mimi, wife and dog lover. Huge Buckeye fan - really all sports - and my husband and I are Ohio State alumni.

neighborhood_overview:
Olde Towne East (OTE) is one of Columbus' largest, historic neighborhoods. We live in an up and coming, mixed neighborhood with a lot of personality. All types of people live in OTE and its many charms include beautiful homes, impressive churches, and the nearby Franklin Park Conservatory.

On our street you will find a mix of many updated homes, newly built luxury condos & apartments nestled in-between public housing. Our home is a block away from the historic Bryden Road which houses many old 1800s style Victorian mansions being renovated. We are a quick & easy 10 minute or less walk to local OTE bars/restaurants.

neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.
The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Victorian Village Village.

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads such as High Street, Summit, and 5th Ave.

neighborhood_overview:
The Columbus version of New York’s Harlem, King-Lincoln Bronzeville, draws people whose appetite for poetry, music, and creativity abounds with enthusiasm for the diverse community. Whether referred to as King-Lincoln Bronzeville, North of Broad, KLD, or the ‘cool’ shorthand for North of Broad: NoBo, this neighborhood’s roots extend deep in African-American culture, heritage, jazz, and the civil rights movement. All of which are embraced by the community through landmarks, architecture, and in the restoration of buildings. The Lincoln Theatre, for example, was recently restored to its original condition.

King-Lincoln Bronzeville also encourages the use of its parks, including Mayme Moore Park and Beatty Park. Other nearby parks include Saunders Park and Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Gardens located within the limits of the Near East Side. neighborhood_overview:
Olde Towne East is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Columbus and is currently undergoing rapid revitalization. The neighborhood has over 1,000 homes, some as old as the 1830s, and more than 50 architectural styles as a result of its history. Some homes have been restored and others remain untouched, as they are reminders of eras that have gone before. Our street and surrounding streets are some of the safest blocks in Columbus! For more information about the neighborhood, check out crime heat maps online, g@@gle map view or search, and learn a little bit more about the history of the community!

Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at local favorite Carabar. neighborhood_overview:
Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at local favorite Carabar. On Oak Street, try breakfast at vegan-friendly The Angry Baker, lunch at the Olde Towne Tavern and dinner and a huge beer list at Yellow Brick Pizza. Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Gardens lies just east, with an awe-inspiring glass house, lit by night with colorful installation by James Turrell, inside gardens representing many of the world’s biomes, and an outstanding community garden campus that also hosts cooking and horticulture classes throughout the year. The brand new Scotts Miracle-Gro Foundation's Children's Garden focuses on introducing and connecting children to the natural world.

name: 4 Blocks From OSU, Short North & Close 2 Downtown!
description:
It's 4 blocks away from campus and close to downtown! The area is quiet but upbeat. It has my bedroom, an office and a bedroom for you!

You'll have a trail mix bar kept fresh by Mason jars so you'll always have fresh snacks at your disposal.

The room has a TV with access to cable and Chrome, so you that you can control things like Netflix right from your phone!

The room has air conditioning. And the bathroom has access to products you might have forgotten. We want to make this a home.🤗

The space
It is a big townhouse that is always kept very clean. We have 3 bedroom a reasonably large kitchen. 1.5 bathrooms and tv with Google Chrome in your room.

You'll have access to all my amenities. I even have a washer and dryer! I'm only accepting long-term rentals for now.

I have been here for over 7 years. It is very important for it to always be in its best condition.

Guest access
The guests
neighborhood_overview: I live across the street from a bird sanctuary. There is also a solid mixture of people who live in neighborhood. This is a lot of people who have lived here a long time, PhD candidates, and young professionals
host_about: I'm a bubbly and personable individual that loves to travel. Though I love to travel and explore, but not, I guess, in the traditional sense. I'm interested in acquiring a piece of the experience that makes a city interesting and different. I have a propensity to ask about local bars and eateries when I arrive and not give Yelp complete control of my travel experience.

Local, Columbus residents with no prior reviews will be required to pay a security deposit before booking.

This is a 1BD home with a queen bed as well as a queen pull out couch (very nice & comfortable).

There is only 1 private parkig space. Other vehicles can be accomodated 1 block away.

Guest

name: The Clintonville Red House
description:
Cozy and clean Clintonville House in wonderful central location! Walking distance to High Street, shops, restaurants, and bus routes. Easy access to 71 and 315. A quick drive, uber or bus ride from campus, downtown and the airport. Are you a runner or biker? Hit the Olentangy River trail in under 10 minutes. Enjoy access to the entire house, which sleeps 6 adults comfortably + a sofa bed and a futon. We also have a pack and play available if needed.

The space
Traveling for work or with family can be tough. This house is fully equipped for comfort and functionality with a work space, and high speed internet, dining table that seats 6-7, large screen TV, and everything you need to travel for work, pleasure and with family including a fully stocked kitchen as well as toys, pack and play, infant swing, high chair, toys and a stroller available on request.

Guest access
You have access to the entire house, front porch and yard, includi
neighborhood_overview:
location- location- location!

This is a lovely, walkable neighborhood with sidewalks. There are several schools with playgrounds that are open to the public on weekends and after hours within .25 miles.

A non exhaustive list of walkable restaurants includes:
Panera, Chipotle, & Juice Co, 61-Pho, Juice & Co and Crimson Cup Coffee are literally 300 yards away. If you are willing to walk up to half a mile you can reach Fusian Asian Cuisine, Jeni's Ice cream, Jersey Mike's Subs, North Star, Little Eater and Hot Chicken Takeover.

Less than a mile North is Graceland Shopping Center with a Target, Krogers, Michael's Crafts, LA Fitness, and tons of restaurants.

There is an access point to the Olentangy River Trail .75 miles from your front door.
We are minutes from 71 and 315.

Additionally we are:
- 10 minutes from OSU and Riverside Hospitals
- 15 minutes from the airport
- 10 minutes from OSU
- 18
host_about: I'm a working mother, and an avid traveler.   I've been around the world alone and with my family and try and channel those experiences into making The Red House into the best possible air bnb for groups and families that are traveling for any reason!

name: Gray Room - Olde Towne/Franklin Park-Historic Home
description:
Enjoy a beautiful private room in this large house on historic Bryden Road. Comfortable queen bed with plenty of storage in the room along with a fireplace and a tv with DVD player. Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+. I live in the house along with my dog Juneau. She’s a young husky mix pup that loves everyone!

The space
Nicely updated home in a quiet location close to downtown Columbus.

The bedroom: Large private room with a comfortable queen bed with luxurious bedding, plenty of storage, TV with Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+. This bedroom has a corner desk allowing plenty of work space. Also enjoy your own private, 2nd floor balcony overlooking the back yard. Shared bathroom. I have another room available to book if you have a group or should this room be unavailable for your dates - check out the Map Room!

The house: All brick 2500 sq ft craftsman built in 1914 and had a major face-lift on its 100th birthday. Gleaming hardwood floo
neighborhood_overview: Olde Towne East, or as I like to call it... The East Village, is a charming residential neighborhood with history around every corner.  In the late 1800's and early 1900's some of Columbus' wealthiest and most influential citizens built beautiful homes on Bryden Road.  Technically we are located in the Franklin Park Neighborhood but everyone around Columbus usually refers to the entire area as Olde Towne.
host_about:
I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2014 and since I love to travel I have also been a guest with other hosts in the US and internationally. People always ask if it’s weird to have strangers come and stay in my home with me and the answer has always been “not once!” I really love having the opportunity to share my home and city of Columbus Ohio with travelers from all over the world. So far I have welcomed people from 6 out of 7 continents coming from more than 50 different countries.

When I bought my home in 2008 it had broken plumbing, boarded up windows, and had been the ugly house on the block for a long time. It’s taken a lot of time and patience but a house that was forgotten and uninhabitable became a warm and charming place I like to call home. 

I’m proud of the work I’ve done to bring a historic building back to life and update it in a way that kept much of the original character. Be careful asking questions about the process because I may not stop telling stories for a while.

In the fall of 2019 I adopted a husky/boxer puppy.  Her name is Juneau and she is super friendly and loves welcoming guests to our home.

name: Updated suite in safe and quiet neighborhood
description:
Private suite with your own separate entrance! There is one bedroom, living room, bathroom, and eating/kitchen area. You have complete privacy, there is no shared area and your space is closed off with a door. There use to be an open set of steps connecting your space with the rest of the house but I have added a door and made it totally private. You will not see or hear from me unless you want to. The space is completely renovated and clean and modern throughout including wifi and basic TV

The space
This space is very modern, simple, and clean. There is plenty of room and has everything you should need for a short stay.

Other things to note
You are about 10 minutes away from OSU campus and the football stadium and 15 minutes away from downtown. There are plenty of restaurants close by and freeway access is only a few minutes away

neighborhood_overview: Very safe, nice neighborhood in the north end of Columbus
host_about: I have a passion for traveling and meeting new people and hearing their stories. I did a study abroad program in college called Semester at Sea, and it completely changed me.  Ever since then I prefer to stay in peoples homes when I travel, as opposed to a hotel.  The more experiences and stories you have in life, the better!  5 things I couldn't live without?  The Bible, my family, pizza, The Office, and the gym I belong to.
