name: Comfy place near downtown.
description:
I'm honored you chose my property. During your stay, you'll enjoy a spacious 1,100 square feet apartment, close to restaurants, family-friendly activities, and a 5 minute drive downtown. You’ll love the proximity to downtown, comfy living, in an up and coming neighborhood that is being gentrified. As last minute cancellations are costly - My place is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers who are committed to their booking dates.

The space
I require a profile contain a face picture, a current government issued photo ID , a current phone number and email address. Before sending inquiries, make sure your profile is updated, otherwise, I will decline your inquiry.

The property is ideally located 5 minutes from COSI and Downtown Columbus - only a 8 minute drive to the Convention Center. Minutes from restaurants, entertainment and the business sectors. Simply take either Town or Broad Street East for a quick 5 minute ride to downtown
neighborhood_overview:
What I love about the neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors and it's proximity to the downtown area. Franklinton is an old community. The local city and state government are spending millions gentrifying this neighborhood.
It is 5 minutes from Downtown/Arena District. (Nationwide Arena, Express Live, North Market), 9 minutes from the infamous Short North. The "art & soul" of Columbus, the Short North is a vibrant cultural and small business community. Park your car along Goodale Park on Buttles Ave for free and gallery hop, thrift or have dinner/drinks at just about any type of bar. 8 minutes away from the Greater Convention Center.

Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

name: Wincott Place - A Clintonville Gem
description:
Wincott Place is a single family home, in the heart of Clintonville with easy access to 315 and 71. On-street parking outside the front door.

Perfect for a fun weekend getaway, weekday business trip, or longer stay. One night stays available. A close drive to the Short North, Grandview, Ohio State University, Downtown, Easton (in and outdoor mall) and Polaris (IKEA and indoor mall) for shopping trips.

No pets allowed.

Entire house and contents are pet and smoke free.

The space
The kitchen is fully stocked and available to you for cooking, baking, or heating up leftovers. The table seats 2-4 people, with a larger table outside in the screened-in porch. We also have children's dishes, cups, and utensils for the younger crowd staying at the house.

We try to be mindful of the earth and conservation. Wincott Place has general recycling available for our guests. If you are not sure if something can be recycled, leave it f
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet single family home neighborhood. Several restaurants nearby along High street, North and South.

Clintonville is a great place to live and is in the perfect location. Close enough to downtown Columbus to go whenever you want, yet you still feel like you are in your own neighborhood apart from the rest. There are many things to do and see. High street has many cool, quirky, unique shops and restaurants. The people are open-minded, welcoming, and kind; which gives Clintonville that community feeling. When the tight knit community becomes too much, you can take a quick trip into downtown Columbus, the Short North, or pretty much any other part of Columbus, because Clintonville is right in the center of it.
host_about:
We live in Clintonville and have four cats and a dog.  We live and work in the community. As the hosts of Wincott Place we want our guests to feel comfortable and at home when they stay with us.  

Having stayed on friend's couches, in numerous hotel rooms, BNB's, and Airbnb the conversation has always centered on what would we do differently as a host.  From having a throw blanket for lounging on the couch, that certain kitchen tool, green space outside,  to having games available to play as a group or family. 

We try to be mindful of the earth and conservation. Our rental has general recycling available for our guests. If you are not sure if something can be recycled, leave it for us and we will make the decision for you. We also compost food. Leave us your leftovers (and scrap remnants if you like) in the refrigerator. The local composting company we work with that will even take meat and bones. 

Each of our animals has their own distinct personalities that make us smile and want to give them a hug.  This does not mean that everyone else does though. We each have several family members with pet allergies so we want there to be somewhere that is pet free, has items in it that have not been in contact with animals, like Wincott Place, to keep allergies at bay.

description:
Sip Keurig coffee and sense the history of this home in its tall ceilings, period fireplace, vintage moldings, and exposed brick. Black and white notes offset with yellow touches are more recent additions, with Roku TVs the last word in modernity.

License number
2019-1891
neighborhood_overview: Located in historic Italian Village and part of the vibrant Short North Arts District, the neighborhood is rich with activity. Worth checking out are the new gym, brewery, and pool. The area is filled with galleries and dining destinations.
host_about:
We are Zach and Cathleen. We’ve grown up together, here in town. We’ve been married the better half of ten years and for most of them, we’ve owned this property here in Italian Village Eventually, we hope to end up out west but until then, Columbus is home!

We lived next door in this duplex property until only recently. We now have family friends renting in our place. We absolutely loved this neighborhood and together, our family loves to go for a walk on the weekends...  either to grab a coffee and enjoy the park nearby or catch up with friends and family over breakfast on the weekends. Tasi Cafe and The Market are our faves!

If you stay at our property, we want you to feel welcome! We are casual people but want to provide you with an excellent experience. If there is anything you need, don’t hesitate to ask.

name: Dempsey’s Jury Room Guest Suite  Downtown Columbus
description:
Located in the River South area in Downtown Columbus, we are within walking distance to German Village, Downtown theaters, restaurants and the Columbus Commons. The Arena District and the Short North is a quick Cbus ride away. Built in two phases, 1831 and 1885, our home has been everything from a stagecoach stop to a bordello in the 1850's. We are offering second floor private space with 2 bedrooms and a sitting room with a sofa sleeper.

The space
Private and secure, this suite once served as sleeping quarters for visiting judges in the late 1800's. In recent years it's been used as office space but we've lovingly restored it into a cozy and clean retreat. Interesting note: because the building is one of the oldest buildings in Columbus (the old gal has quite a past) it is said to be haunted. I've lived here for almost 3 years and haven't seen a thing but a quick search of The Jury Room Columbus may provide some interesting history.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: Located in the River South area of Downtown, we are close to everything but enjoy the relative quiet from not being in the center of the city. There are several restaurant options within walking distance. Notably, Dempsey's Food & Spirits (shameless plug for our restaurant) at the corner of Mound & High that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner & days a week. :)
host_about: My husband Mark and I are small business owners in Columbus, Ohio. We have 5 children and 6 grandchildren.

Just a 2 minute walk to Chipotle, or to a nice neighborhood cafe that serves breakfast and lunch - we’re also very near Ohio State University, downtown Grandview (many great restaurants) and the Short North.

The space
This is a first floor apartment in a duplex building - completely renovated in fall 2018! New floors, new carpet, fresh paint, and an updated bathroom and kitchen appliances.

The apartment has private exterior entrances and a dedicated HVAC system - no shared spaces with the upstairs apartment (except for the back yard). The upstairs neighbor is very quiet.

neighborhood_overview: The Grandview neighborhood in central Columbus is home to many young working professionals, families, and recent graduates. The area is known for its great restaurants, fun and unique stores, and vintage furniture and antique shops.
host_about: Enjoy golf, boating, snowboarding and visiting local craft breweries.

name: The Harrison West Carriage House
description:
Be a part of one of Columbus' historic neighborhoods when you stay in our Harrison West Carriage House. You are steps from the best breakfast you will find in the city and just a couple of blocks from the Short North/High Street, the Olentangy River Trail, The Ohio Stadium and Nationwide Arena - just to name a few. This newly built, spacious studio offers all of the conveniences you could ask for with the characteristic charm this area is known for. Washer/dryer available for long-term guests

The space
Our Carriage House is a studio space, but at 800 square feet and with huge 11 foot ceilings, it feels very spacious!

Guest access
You will have complete privacy with your private entrance off the alley behind our home.

License number
2019-1817
neighborhood_overview: Harrison West is a unique neighborhood just on the outskirts of the Short North.  You will be steps from the best breakfast in town at Katalina's as well as two local bars, Subway, and a convenience store all less than a block away.  You are also just a few blocks from the Olentangy River Trail and drop in for canoes/kayaks.  You are also within walking distance to High Street/Short North with the best shopping and restaurants in Columbus as well as Express Live, Nationwide Arena, and The Ohio Stadium.

description:

description:
Don't miss this opportunity to stay in this spacious home!

This house has 6 rooms and 2 1/2 bathrooms and is located in the OSU area. Stunning woodwork, granite countertops, and spacious rooms. Incredibly comfy beds, and plenty of cooking space. Easy access to I-71, and just a quick trip downtown, Short North, Italian Village, MAPFRE Stadium and more!

The space
Great location, that is a just a few minutes away from OSU campus. Easy access to COTA bus stop, CABS (OSU's bus system), and local freeways. COSI, Schottenstein Center, OSU football stadium, Riverside Hospital, Newport Music Hall, Short North, and so much more!

Guests have access to all rooms and closets in the house, including the basement, where the washer & dryer is located.

Beautiful, newly remodeled home in Grove City just south of Columbus. This home is in a quiet neighborhood in beautiful Grove City - close to Berliner Park, 270 & 71. It features brand new furniture, an open living area, spacious basement and a sprawling back deck with yard. Grove City has shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It is also just a short drive from downtown Columbus and the many amenities it has to offer.

7 miles to Downtown Columbus (10 min)
10 miles to Ohio State University

The space
Features:
3 Bedrooms all with Queen sized beds
1.5 Baths
2 Living Areas
2 TV's with Roku devices

neighborhood_overview: This home is located in a single family, quiet neighborhood with sidewalks throughout. The backyard backs onto a neighborhood park (have to walk around to get there). Yet, Grove City is now the second largest suburb of Columbus and one of the fastest growing cities in central Ohio. Come see why people are moving to our city!

name: Huge German Village 3BD/2BA Close to Everything!
description:
Our two story house is a 3 bed/2 bath in historic German Village. The house has been completely updated! All of the furniture and mattresses are brand new! The house also has a huge backyard with garage parking! The house is located on a historic street near well-kept Schiller Park (23 acres). The location of this house is perfect - an easy commute to anywhere in Columbus. We are located nearby to all of the benefits in German Village - great restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, and bars.

The space
This is an ideal home for couples, families, or groups of friends! Our house is completely updated and all furnishings are brand new. There are brand new memory foam mattresses and all new furniture throughout the place. The house has 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms. There is one full bathroom on each floor. The kitchen has brand new appliances and there is a brand new washer/dryer on the first floor of the house. The outdoor space is amazing for hanging out. There are
neighborhood_overview:
German Village is a historic Columbus community and is known for gorgeous brick streets and architecture. Historic restaurants and bars are prominent within the area and are easily accessibly from our house. 7 Minutes from Downtown Columbus, 10 minutes from Ohio State Campus and Ohio Stadium, 7 Minutes to the Columbus Convention center, 15 Minutes from the Columbus Airport, 5 Minutes to Nationwide Children’s Hospital, and very close to 12 4+ Star rated restaurants on Yelp! Our house is a 5 minute walk to a large grocery store.

A warm, charming, historical, and walkable neighborhood which is also a diverse and friendly community. It is further enhanced by large (23 acre) and well-kept Schiller Park, which has the lovely Huntington Garden, dozens of mature trees, a lake, tennis courts, picnic area, and people walking their dogs.

name: Judge’s Mansion Entire Home: @judgesmansion
description:
Judge’s Mansion is located in Olde Towne East, one of the best and oldest neighborhoods in Columbus. Rent the entire Mansion for a getaway, a family reunion, or for your wedding party. We are located close to Franklin Park and Downtown. Tastefully designed and thoughtfully laid out to create a balance of comfort and thought provoking, Instagram-able, photo ready space for you to enjoy during your stay in Columbus. IG: @judgesmansion

The space
Judge’s Mansion was built for Judge Edmond Bothwell Dillon in the late 1800s in historic Olde Towne East. The building has since been converted into several private apartments. We welcome you into our home and hope you love the large windows, tall ceilings, grand staircase, and Victorian character as much as we do. Our home features several apartments of varying sizes and decor, and also includes a front porch and large yard.

Guest access
You have access to the entire Mansion, all 8 apartment units.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in Olde Towne East, Columbus, Ohio, we are the premier Guest House of the Near East Side (Olde Towne East, Franklin Park, King Lincoln, Woodland Park) offering six apartments and two queen en suites. In operation since 2015, we host over 1000 guests a year. Will you consider being one?

Connect with us @judgesmansion @thejudgesmansion

Stay for a night or three, shoot on location here, or meet up with friends. #belonghere #judgesmansion

Olde Towne East is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Columbus and is currently undergoing rapid revitalization. The neighborhood has over 1,000 homes, some as old as the 1830s, and more than 50 architectural styles as a result of its history. Some homes have been restored and others remain untouched as reminders of eras that have gone before. Our street and surrounding streets are some of the safest blocks in Columbus! name: Vintage Townhome w/Cozy Loft & Two Private Suites
description:
Newly remodeled 1/2 duplex with two suites, each with their own full en-suite bathroom. Perfect for couples! Located right off High St in German Village, just a few minutes' walk to coffee shops, breweries, restaurants, cafes, parks, yoga & public transportation.

The space
This listing is for one half of a remodeled two-unit duplex built over 100 years ago. The unit is about 1300 square feet across 3 floors. The first floor has a living room, dining room, kitchen and small powder room. A unique Y staircase leads up to the two newly remodeled private suites on the second floor. Shoes, food and/or drink are not permitted in the home’s 3rd floor loft because of its white carpet.

The spacious main suite features a memory foam King bed, both down & down alternative pillows, a reading nook, and a large bathroom with an oversized walk-in shower, clawfoot tub, and double vanity. *Please note that there is a curtain dividing the master bedroom from master
neighborhood_overview:
German Village is a vibrant place to stay, shop, and play. Walking the brick sidewalks, you'll discover a neighborhood full of urban gardens, beautiful historic homes built over 100 years ago, and carefully dispersed small businesses. As said on the German Village visitor's website, “What we have can't be replicated. We live this way — and protect it with great passion — because we understand that what we have is a neighborhood like no other." We couldn't agree more.

Schiller Park is a pleasant 8 minute walk from the property through some of the most charming streets in German Village, making it easy to go for a walk/run, have a picnic, bring the kids to the playground, and enjoy free performances of Shakespeare in the Park in the summertime. The park also has basketball courts and tennis courts.

Another one of our favorite parks is Scioto Audubon Metro Park, which is located .8 miles from the house. The park has a large rock climbing wall, walking paths (both
host_about:
Hi! We’re Catherine & Bryan: husband & wife, small business owners, designers and Superhosts. After living in NYC, we decided to move to Columbus, OH in 2013 in search of a better quality of life. We’ve welcomed thousands of guests to our properties in Italian Village and German Village since 2014, and have loved sharing our homes and our city with guests from near and far.

Find us on IG @beginninginthemiddle and @thevillagehost.

This home away from home nestled between Worthington & Clintonville is perfectly located to get you to anywhere in the city in less than 15 minutes. Preview my collection on Instagram #bonesbnb

The space

Guest access

neighborhood_overview: "In leafy, residential Clintonville, laid-back cafes, gastropubs, and indie shops selling records and locally made crafts are clustered on N. High Street and Indianola Avenue. The Park of Roses features thousands of rose bushes, plus herb and perennial flower gardens."

name: Spacious 3br Perfect for OSU & Exploring Columbus!
description:
Spacious 3 bedroom house, with separate loft & breakfast nook centrally located to Ohio State Campus (walkable), Short North, Clintonville and more! Our house is a wonderful landing pad for couples, families and groups visiting Ohio State and the surrounding areas. A fully stocked kitchen & bathroom, spacious living & dining area & 4 car off street parking will ensure a comfortable stay while you experience all that Columbus has to offer!

The space
The House:
Built in 1900, the house boasts original woodwork & fixtures lending to a cozy & "old" Columbus feel.

The Living Space:
Open Living & Dining area with dining table + 4 chairs (high chair & baby gate available upon request) + mounted smart TV.
Breakfast Nook with table + 2 chairs
Full size fully stocked kitchen with cookware, plates/bowls/silverware/steak knives, drinking/wine glasses & plastic kids eating sets. Dishwasher, single serve coffee as well as an 8 cup coffee make
neighborhood_overview:
This house is in the "Old North Columbus" neighborhood just north of Ohio State Campus. Conveniently located (10min walk) to High Street bustling with students, bars, restaurants etc. Located on a main street primarily surrounded by a mix student rentals & single family homes, this home is a perfect location for an Ohio State game day with campus buzz at your fingertips while still being a comfy retreat after a long day of exploring Columbus.

- 1/2 mile (10min walk) to the iconic High/Lane intersection in the heart of Ohio State Campus ( and TAILGATE CENTRAL for Ohio Stadium).
- 1 mile (20min walk) to the MAPFRE/ Crew Stadium (professional soccer)
- 3 miles (10 min drive) to the Short North Arts District with loads of trendy restaurants, shops, bars & galleries.
-1.5 miles (5 min drive) to the Ohio Expo Center/Home of the Ohio State Fair
- 3.5 miles (10 min drive) to Nationwide Arena, the Columbus Convention Center & Huntington Park ( helloooo, BlueJ
host_about:
My wife and I are Columbus, Ohio natives living in the Bay Area. As guests, we love cozy spaces, meeting new people and adventures! Bonus points for dog friendly adventures :) 
.
Our home in Columbus is perfect for couples, families & groups exploring what Ohio State University & Columbus has to offer! Just blocks away from Ohio Stadium you'll have the FULL midwest tailgating experience at your fingertips. If football isn't your thing, then the historic Short North Arts District is a mile down the road. Have fun and enjoy some midwest hospitality!

name: *~Charming Home +Central Location~* 4 Bedrooms/2ba
description:
Vintage 1920s home close to OSU, Short North, stadiums, and Expo Center. You’ll have the top two floors of the townhouse with 4 bedrooms, a living room/kitchen, and 2 full baths! Free private parking behind house / free street parking. Private keyless entry through side door.

The space
Your spaces will be totally private, and you can come and go as you please through the side door. You’ll have the entire second floor and third floor of the town house. Window air conditioning units and central heating is available. Video cameras on premises - exterior only.

This is a comfortable older home with updated baths and appliances. Although it's not a luxury apartment, it's a cozy place to stay with basic amenities.

HOME DETAILS:

name: Judge’s Mansion: The Judge’s Study
description:
Located in the historic Judge’s Mansion in Olde Towne East, this spacious guest suite served as the original owner's study in 1890. The private apartment includes a bedroom (queen bed), living room (queen sofa bed), bath and small kitchen. There’s plenty of open space to spread out or share with a travel companion. Tastefully designed and thoughtfully laid out to create a balance of comfort and thought provoking, Instagram-able, photo ready space for you to enjoy. IG @judgesmansion

The space
Judge’s Mansion was built for Judge Edmond Bothwell Dillon in the late 1800s in historic Olde Towne East. The building has since been converted into several private apartments but still remains home to us. We welcome you into our home and hope you love the large windows, tall ceilings, sliding pocket door, and Victorian character as much as we do. Our home features several apartments of varying sizes and decor. The Judge’s Study featured in this listing is a 1-bedroom apartm
neighborhood_overview: Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at local favorite Carabar. On Oak Street, try breakfast at vegan-friendly The Angry Baker, lunch at the Olde Towne Tavern and dinner and a huge beer list at Yellow Brick Pizza. Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Gardens lies just east, with an awe-inspiring glass house, lit by night with colorful installation by James Turrell, inside gardens representing many of the world’s biomes, and an outstanding community garden campus that also hosts cooking and horticulture classes throughout the year. The brand new Scotts Miracle-Gro Foundation's Children's Garden focuses on introducing and connecting children to the natural world.
host_about:
Located in Olde Towne East, Columbus, Ohio, we are the premier Guest House of the Near East Side (Olde Towne East, Franklin Park, King Lincoln, Woodland Park) offering six apartments and two queen en suites.  In operation since 2015, we host over 100 guests per year. Will you consider being one?  

Connect with us @judgesmansion on IG 

Stay for a night or three, shoot on location here, or meet up with friends.  #judgesmansion #judgesmansiondreams

Olde Towne East is one of the best neighborhoods in Columbus, and is the oldest area in Columbus, currently undergoing rapid revitalization. The neighborhood has over 1,000 homes, some as old as the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s, and more than 50 architectural styles as a result of its history. Some homes have been restored and others remain untouched as reminders of eras that have gone before. Our street and surrounding streets are some of the safest blocks in Columbus! Just check out crime heat maps online, g@@gle map view or search, and learn a little bit more about the history of the community!

name: 1BR Condo w/ Best Location in City~Short North
description:
There is not a better location in all of Columbus...This 1 Bedroom, 1 Bath condo is located on High Street in the Short North. It has private parking options in the back on Pearl and is walking distance to all the best restaurants and bars the Short North has to offer. It is a 4 minute walk to the Convention Center, across the street from Goodale Park, and a 5 minute uber from OSU campus, German Village, and Nationwide Children's Hospital. Come live in the middle of it all!

The space
This apartment is perfect for business, families, and anyone looking to enjoy the city of Columbus in absolute style. It has private off street parking options in the back that are first come first serve. The unit is fully equipped with a washer/dryer, fridge, microwave, oven, and coffee brewer. The bedroom is very large and contains one Queen memory foam bed with a large closet with shelving for all your clothing needs. I live right next door and will be available right away if nee
neighborhood_overview: The Short North is where all the action is. It is the most centralized location in Columbus and sets the bar for all other neighborhoods. You are literally right above some of the best coffee shops, restaurants, and bars the city has to offer. It is a short walk from the Columbus Convention Center, Nationwide Arena, and Goodale Park. Less than 15 minutes from the airport and a 5 minute uber from Nationwide Children's, OSU campus, and German Village.
host_about: I am from Springfield, OH and went to college at OSU where I traveled abroad in Barcelona. I moved to Chicago for a couple years and got some corporate experience in a fun city. I then moved back to Columbus where I live currently in the Short North with my beautiful fiancée. I help run my family's coffee and vending business, called Sheehan Brothers. I love traveling, golfing, eating and most importantly The Buckeyes!!

Located on the edge of downtown in the Short North Arts District, 50 Lincoln Short North Bed and Breakfast is nestled in a quiet residential neighborhood setting.
Each of our seven rooms feature in-room private full bath, free Wi-Fi, and cable TV. We also include free off-street parking and a delicious homemade breakfast every morning. Breakfast includes juice, hot coffee or tea, fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, and a specially prepared entrée each day (all food allergies can be accommodated).

The space
Room 6 is located on the third floor and is a mirror image of Room 5. It has a queen size bed, comfortable sitting chair, and small secretary desk. The west facing skylight fills the room with warm afternoon light. This room also features a full in-room bathroom complete with tub/shower combo and hairdryer.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to make themselves at home in any of the public areas including the main parlor and the back porch. W

Enjoy a quick walk through the neighborhood, grab a COGO Bike Share a block from our front door, or jump on the free CBUS on High Street to get around.

name: Charming Clintonville Cottage
description:
This cosy, ivy-covered, one bedroom carriage house is charming and welcoming, filled with original art and furnished with a sophisticated blend of modern, mid-Century and antique pieces. It's located in the heart of friendly, convenient South Clintonville, near great restaurants and all the amenities, and a mile and a half from OSU Campus.

The space
Curl up and read or watch TV in the comfy queen-sized four-poster bed. If you'd prefer to cook at home during your stay, you'll find a fully stocked kitchen with 5-burner gas stove and dining area. In nice weather, there's a lovely outdoor sitting area under a crabapple tree, just outside the front door, set far back from the street for privacy.

License number
2019-1924
neighborhood_overview: One of the oldest and most desirable neighborhoods in Columbus, Clintonville is perfectly situated no matter what your destination is, not more than a fifteen minute drive to the Short North, German Village, Downtown, Olde Towne East or OSU Stadium. Walk a block and a half down our tree-lined street of lovely Craftsman-style homes, and you're on N High St, the city's main artery, with convenient bus stops if you'll be seeking public transportation. There you'll find tons of popular eateries, craft breweries, boutiques, antique stores, and night spots. One of our local favorites for dinner is Harvest Bar & Kitchen and you won't find a better brunch or piece of pie than Dough Mama's Cafe & Bakery - don't miss out on their ham or avocado biscuit!  Lucky's Market is just a few minutes away, like a smaller, cooler Whole Foods, and Ace of Cups is a  bar to catch some Columbus's great local bands. On a nice day, ride your bike all along the Olentangy River on the nearby bike path or take a wa
host_about: I'm a painter based in Brooklyn, NY and worked in the theatre for thirty years as a director and teacher.  My husband, Lee, is an actor and we have one daughter who's a chef and baker in Columbus, Ohio. We purchased our guest house to have a home to stay in when we visit her, and host travelers when we aren’t in town. We travel as often as we can and have been to every continent except Antarctica. Our most recent big trip was India last fall. We love to eat and go to museums and just wander through new places, absorb the culture and discover things that surprise us. Our goal is always to experience a place from a local's POV, so we try to stay in real neighborhoods instead of tourist zones.

neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.
The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Italian Village on Summit St., between First Ave and Warren St. Just two blocks away from High Street!

- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host

neighborhood_overview:
German Village is a historic Columbus community and is known for gorgeous brick streets and architecture. Historic restaurants and bars are prominent within the area and are easily accessibly from our house. 10 minutes from Ohio State Campus and Ohio Stadium, 10 Minutes to the Columbus Convention center, 15 Minutes from the Columbus Airport and very close to 12 4+ Star rated restaurants on Yelp! Our house is a 5 minute drive to a large grocery store.

A warm, charming, historical, and walk-able neighborhood which is also a diverse and friendly community. It is further enhanced by large (23 acre) and well-kept Schiller Park, which has the lovely Huntington Garden, dozens of mature trees, a lake, tennis courts, picnic area, and people walking their dogs.

host_about:
I was born and raised in Youngstown, a small city in Northeastern Ohio. After settling down in the great city of Columbus I fell in love with hosting on AirBnB!  

I work full-time for an engineering company doing survey work. I love the fact that I can be hospitable and host people from all around the world even while having a full-time Job. 

I'm big into fitness, reading, movies, and I'm always trying to reach bigger goals.
One of my favorite things to do is go to the movies and watch a good comedy, the seats in the Easton AMC theater are amazing!

I'm heavily involved in church and want to be a missionary one day, but right now I'm living on mission the best I can trying to serve anyone I can.  I love being hospitable to all and I do my best to exceed your expectations.

name: Steps from The Short North and Convention Center
description:
This property is located on 4th street in Italian Village, one of the most walkable neighborhoods in Columbus. Located east of the Short North Arts District, just north of the Convention Center, and south of OSU. The central location makes this an ideal property for families, groups, business travelers, or tourists exploring. With common areas on the entire 1st floor and part of the 3rd floor, plus 3 private bedrooms there is plenty of space for groups and families to spread out.

The space
Features: Hardwood floors in living areas. Original features such as, decorative fireplace and pocket doors. Ceiling fans in the living room, dining room, and both second floor bedrooms. Carpet on second floor. New kitchen with updated appliances. Central A/C. High efficiency furnace. Washer and dryer included along with detergent. One on street parking pass provided. New windows with top-down-bottom up window treatments.

This property is a 3 story, half
neighborhood_overview:
This property is located in Italian Village. It is within walking distance to the Short North, the Convention Center, and Downtown. We are 1.5 miles to OSU campus, 1.7 miles to the OSU Stadium, 0.6 miles to the Convention Center, 2 miles to Mapfre stadium for Crew games or concerts, and 6 miles to the Columbus International Airport. There are a number of breweries, bakeries, restaurants, and parks within a few blocks of our house A gym, GO fitness, is located a short 5 minute walk south where a day pass can be purchased. There is also a public pool at this location. The cost is $10 for a day pass. There are multiple yoga studios in the area with the closest being right across the street.


Italian Village has a number of fantastic places to visit (walking time): Fox and the Snow bakery (2 mins), Cosecha (across 4th street), Hoof Hearted Brewery (4 mins), Italian Market (4 mins), Seventh Son Brewery (3 mins), The Table (11 mins), Little Rock (1 min), St. Jame
host_about: Jarrod and I both have a love of travel.  We have spent a number of years traveling the country.  Spending time on the west coast, east coast, and a few places in between, we have used AirBNB and other services to facilitate our stays in furnished, private residences for a  few days up to a few months at a time.  A great experience depends on a great property in the right location and great service from the host.  As fellow travelers, we want to provide you that great experience.  We are excited to open our property and  neighborhood up to travelers looking to visit Columbus.  We spent years updating and restoring our 100+ years old property, and while we were working, our neighborhood also revitalized adding many wonderful food and entertainment options.  Whether you stick to 4th St and the Short North for your fun or go exploring through the wider Columbus, we look forward to showing off our home and hometown.  Even if you decide to not stay with us, have a great time in Columbus, there is a lot of great things to discover.

description:
Close to I-71 and I-270, our home is good for solo adventurers or business travelers.
Located in a safe and quiet residential neighborhood on the Northside of Columbus, it is at the center of major points of attraction: 7 mi. from Polaris Mall or Ohio State Fairgrounds, 8 mi. from Easton Mall or OSU, 10 mi. from Greyhound station, 14 mi. from the Airport, and just 3 mi. from Kroger.
If you must eat healthy, no problem! Our local health food store and diner, Raisin Rack, is just 2 miles away.

The space
Located on the 2nd floor, this room is calm and comfortable.
Enjoy the use of your own Coffee machine ~ Choice of teas ~ your own refrigerator, space heater or Air Conditioner. A microwave may be shared with two other guests.
The front porch is a peaceful little place to sit - or work - on sunny or drizzling days.

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located in a peaceful neighborhood, at the end of a peaceful court.
Close to I-71 and I-270 North, our home is at the center of major points of attraction:

• 6 miles from Polaris Place,
• 8 miles from Easton Mall,
• 8 miles easy commute to OSU,
• 2 miles from our local health food store and diner: Raisin Rack

Most Popular Landmarks
• Magic Mountain Fun Center - Polaris: 6 miles
• Columbus Museum of Art: 10.7 miles
• Ohio Theater: 11.2 miles
• Capitol Square: 11.2 miles
• Ballet Met: 10.7 miles
• Italian Village: 10 miles
• Franklin Park Conservatory: 12.2 miles
• Botanical Gardens: 12.2 miles
• COSI: 13 miles

Other points of attraction:
• Ohio Expo Center: 9.2 miles (Ohio State Fair – Exhibitions throughout the year)
• City Center: 11 miles
• Greater Columbus Convention Center: 11 miles
• Columbus Near East Side Historic District: 11.7 miles
• Germa
host_about:
Hello and welcome to Columbus, Ohio! 

My husband is from Japan, an amateur radio lover, chigiri-e artist, sushi chef, and excellent cook. I grew up in a tiny village of the French Alps, enjoy nature, a good movie, and a walk in the park together with my hubby. While taking care of our family, children, and grandchildren, we keep expanding our friendship circle.  

And I am so grateful to our Airbnb community who is bringing such a diverse group of travelers to our doorstep including those who are coming for business, conferences, exhibitions, visiting relatives, nurses and students needing a comfortable bed after a long day of work or training, and even people who are here to relocate. 

We’re friendly and try to provide our guests with what we appreciate when we are away from home – a relaxing, peaceful, and loving place for a refreshing night rest.

name: Livingston Hideaway
description:
Welcome to our home! Our Airbnb is a 2 bedroom condo that is less than 1/2 mile or 2.5 blocks from Nationwide Children's hospital in Downtown Columbus. We hope to provide a comfortable home away from home for families who may be in the area for care at Nationwide Children's Hospital, attending one of Columbus's many large conventions or events, or visiting family or friends in the Columbus area!

The space
The home is a duplex, and we (the owners) live in the 2nd floor unit. The 1st floor Airbnb unit has private front and back entrances, and fully furnished bedrooms, bathroom, kitchen, and living spaces. Private off street parking is available behind the house, along with street parking in front of the house on Livingston Ave. Mattresses, bedding, and linens are all brand new, and the kitchen is stocked with all dishes, pots, pans, and utensils you may need. For convenience and security there is a smart keypad lock on the exterior door that guests can use to enter
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood surrounding the hospital and our home is currently transitioning, with many of the homes in the area being renovated and restored. Our home is one of these homes that has recently been completely renovated. Nationwide Children's Hospital is investing heavily into the surrounding area, helping to make it one of Columbus's many "up and coming" neighborhoods. As a result you will see many beautifully renovated homes right next door to homes that are still boarded up. We ask that you please acknowledge that you understand and are comfortable with the neighborhood prior to booking your stay. We recommend utilizing an online map service to understand where exactly the home is, and to browse around the neighborhood.  We are more than happy to answer any and all questions you may have!
host_about:
Hello! My name is Brandon and I am a young professional living in Columbus, Ohio. I'm an Ohio native, born and raised in Northwest Ohio. I graduated undergrad from THE Ohio State University, moved to Chicago where I lived and worked for a few years, and have now happily settled back down in Columbus. I work for L Brands, the parent company of Victoria's Secret and Bath & Body Works, one of the many retail companies headquartered here in Columbus. I am currently pursuing my Masters of Business Administration at Purdue University via a hybrid on-campus/online program. 
I enjoy traveling whenever and wherever I can, though I definitely prefer someplace warmer when given the option :) Though I love traveling, I am a Columbus fanboy at heart and am always happy to talk about all of the great things to experience here. I'm a very easy going guy, so feel free to ask me any questions that may be on your mind! Happy traveling!

name: The Little Dipper - Near Airport
description:
Automated Keyless Access, TV, Laundry ($3 per load), and full service kitchen. This is a 4 bedroom house and the common area's are shared between me, my roommate Ben, and occasionally Ben's 7 year old son. You will be designated 1 of the Best bedrooms in the house, with a Comfortable Queen size bed, a desk, and a lock on the door for your Privacy. The house sits back in a quiet neighborhood just minutes from the airport and less then 15 minutes to downtown.

The space
As the real estate saying goes, location location location. 5 minutes from the airport! The property is conveniently located between Easton and the Airport, and only about 10 minutes from downtown!

The property is two stories and also includes a basement. When you enter the property you will be in the living room. Upstairs you will find four bedrooms with plenty of closet space. Your room is to the left, down to the end of the hall to the right and next to the bathroom.

host_about:
I was born and raised in Youngstown, a small city in Northeastern Ohio. After settling down in the great city of Columbus I fell in love with hosting on AirBnB!  

I work full-time for an engineering company doing survey work. I love the fact that I can be hospitable and host people from all around the world even while having a full-time Job. 

I'm big into fitness, reading, movies, and I'm always trying to reach bigger goals.
One of my favorite things to do is go to the movies and watch a good comedy, the seats in the Easton AMC theater are amazing!

I'm heavily involved in church and want to be a missionary one day, but right now I'm living on mission the best I can trying to serve anyone I can.  I love being hospitable to all and I do my best to exceed your expectations.

name: Steps from High St. WALK to everything —Clean&Cozy
description:
Stay in the heart of Short North. A beautiful Short North town home one block from high street and Goodale Park. You will be in the heart of bars, amazing restaurants, cafes, shops and tons of night life. Walking distance to all that Short North Arts District has to offer. A 5 min. walk to Goodale Park. A 10 min. walk to Nationwide area (Home of the Columbus Blue Jackets), and Greater Columbus Convention Center (.9mi). A 15 min walk to the OSU campus (1.4 mi) or a short lyft ride.

The space
The Short North town home is a two story home with 1224 sq ft of space for you to use. Large living, Dining Room, Kitchen, 2 bedrooms upstairs, 1.5 bathrooms. The fully-equipped kitchen has pots/pans, dishes, and utensils as well as a Keurig coffee machine. Washer/dryer. There is a 48" smart television with complimentary Netflix. Bottled water and free K-cup pod. Smart TVs and Wifi.

Guest access
You are able to access the entire place.
neighborhood_overview: Short North Arts District is a hip, culture-rich area centered on N. High Street. Contemporary galleries fill converted warehouses, and the Wexner Center for the Arts hosts boundary-pushing exhibitions. Shops selling records, streetwear, and vintage clothes are interspersed with student-packed coffeehouses, craft-beer bars, and casual eateries. Programming at Short North Stage spans musicals and cutting-edge drama.
host_about: I am crazy about real estate.  I love renovating broken down houses to make them look beautiful again.  I love helping people find a solution to their home headaches.  I have lots of long term rentals as well. I'm a people person so I really enjoy hosting because I get to meet some many wonderful people.   In addition to my passion for real estate, I love to be at the beach.  Sunshine, sand and a view of the ocean is my favorite place to be.  I am married to a wonderful man that puts up with all of my crazy adventures.  I also have two very active  kiddos that keep me on my toes.

name: Comfy Queen bed and full bed - four guests
description:
I'm honored you chose my property. During your stay, you'll share a spacious 1,100 square feet apartment with other house guests. You’ll love the proximity to downtown, comfy living, in an up and coming neighborhood that is being gentrified. As last minute cancellations are costly - My place is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers who are committed to their booking dates.

The space
I require a profile contain a face picture, a current government issued photo ID , a current phone number and email address. Before sending inquiries, make sure your profile is updated, otherwise, I will decline your inquiry.

The property is ideally located 5 minutes by car from COSI and Downtown Columbus - only a 8 minute drive to the Convention Center. Minutes from restaurants, entertainment and the business sectors. Simply take either Town or Broad Street East for a quick 5 minute drive to downtown Columbus. Situated in Franklinton, the property e
neighborhood_overview:
What I love about the neighborhood is that it has quiet mature neighbors and it's proximity to the downtown area. Franklinton is an old community. The local city and state government are spending millions gentrifying this neighborhood.
It is 5 minutes from Downtown/Arena District. (Nationwide Arena, Express Live, North Market), 9 minutes from the infamous Short North. The "art & soul" of Columbus, the Short North is a vibrant cultural and small business community. Park your car along Goodale Park on Buttles Ave for free and gallery hop, thrift or have dinner/drinks at just about any type of bar. 8 minutes away from the Greater Convention Center.

Make sure to check out my Guidebook for activities, entertainment and restaurants - it's a reference of all my favorite places in Columbus. I'm a member of a Pizzeria meetup - My favorite mom & pop pizzerias are listed.
host_about:
Howdy! I’m Jake. I’m originally from New York, and while I miss my friends and family back home (not to mention the beach!), I absolutely love my mid-west home here in Columbus, Ohio!
By day I’m a real estate investor and by night I’m a social butterfly with my friends. I'm also an Airbnb cohost where I mentor aspiring local hosts. I earned my Superhost status because I have high standards for value, cleanliness, and communication.
I enjoy travelling and creating new experiences. My favorite country is Guatemala. The people, the food and the historical sites are breathtaking. My favorite city is Chicago. Through these travels and coupled with my 14 years landlording, I’ve been fortunate to learn what makes a great host: a great home, with a friendly host, in an awesome neighborhood, and the ability to do the things you love! I try to ensure that each and every guest I host walks away with all of that and hopefully more.
My life motto is, well, really my grandmother’s advice, “Jakey, live with NO REGRETS” (I can hear her thick NYer accent now). Sometimes I guess we just need a little reminder of that… And so, I invite you to travel more and see the big, beautiful world we live in.

name: Comfortable Room Near Downtown Nationwide & OSU
description:
Almost 1500sqft renovated and tastefully furnished duplex in Old Oaks Historic District with its turn-of-the-century homes. Freshly painted interior in warm soothing gray above polished hard wood floors. Generous & naturally lit rooms with large windows are equipped with high quality brand new memory foam mattress beds and pillows for ultimate comfort. Short distance from markets & restaurants, close to freeways, not far from Nationwide Children's Hospital, Olde Towne East, and German Village.

The space
This listing is for the middle bedroom of the house comes with new wooden ceiling fan, 40' Samsung LCD TV, queen size bed and memory form mattress.

There are total of 3 bedrooms available in this house. You can book one, two bedrooms or the entire house in a separate listing by copy the link as shown below:

XL urban condo w/garage parking a short walk to Arena District & Short North, Convention Center, Downtown Riverfront, Capitol Sq, dining & entertainment. Granite, polished concrete floors, 2 private BRs, 2.5 bathrooms, eat-in kitchen w/island, W/D. Quiet end unit. STRICTLY ENFORCED: NO SMOKING, NO PARTIES / EVENTS.

30-DAY+ STAYS (Submit Inquiry for shorter stays; other properties avail.). Great discounts for 30-day+ stays! Try your dates to see! Ask about bigger discounts for multi-month stays.

The space
Ultra modern design w/new polished concrete floors & granite tile throughout (no carpet). Upscale furniture w/designer touches. Cable TV, Wi-Fi internet. Kitchen is fully equipped including gas range, microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator, toaster oven, coffee maker, tea/water boiler, cookware, all utensils. In-unit washer/dryer (LG Steam Washer all-in-one W/D). Walk-in closet.

Guest access
The listing is for the entire property.
neighborhood_overview: The building is in the Downtown / Arena District neighborhood of Columbus, approx. 2 blocks from Nationwide Arena and 1 block from many popular restaurants, breweries, pubs, cafes, and more along popular Gay Street Corridor. From the property you can easily walk to Convention Center, Short North, riverfront ("Scioto Mile") which hosts most summer festivals, and Capitol Square. Easy access to riverfront biking and jogging path.
host_about: Realtor based in Columbus, OH specializing in urban condominium sales and rentals with a focus on urban properties in and near Downtown Columbus.

name: LUXURY BRAND NEW 3BR/3BA TOWNHOME W/ROOFTOP PATIO!
description:
This stunning 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom townhome will not disappoint! Our home is brand new and finished construction in January 2019.

The space
High end finishes and stainless steel appliances. There is private parking with garage access in the back, as well as on-street parking out front. Large walk in closets and plenty of storage space if you need it. This townhome occupies the top two floors.

Open layout with a beautiful, spacious master on the main floor. The top floor features 2 additional bedrooms, a minibar, and rooftop patio with views of the neighborhood and the downtown Columbus skyline. Our home can accommodate up to 16 people comfortably with the common space sleeping options available. The kitchen is fully stocked and there is a brand new washer and dryer in the laundry room. Comfortable memory foam mattresses and brand new furniture and linens!

Outdoor furniture NOT available during the winter.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the beautiful Harrison West neighborhood, this home is perfectly situated in the heart of the city. Just blocks away from High Street and the Short North attractions, Ohio State's main campus, OSU Wexner Medical Center, and Grandview. Several parks nearby and walking distance to local bars and restaurants.

On High Street you will find shopping, art galleries, bars, and some of the best restaurants in the city in the Short North Arts District. This area of Columbus is one of the city’s most popular destinations!

Notable nearby destinations: OSU Stadium, Nationwide Arena and the surrounding Arena District, Easton Towne Center, John Glenn International Airport, Columbus Convention Center, Nationwide Children’s Hospital, The Ohio Statehouse, and Franklin Park Conservatory.

name: Beautiful home in the heart of Italian Village
description:
This entire home is ideally located in the hippest part of Italian Village. This listing includes both the top and bottom unit of an entire house. In the heart of Italian Village, a short walk to the Short North, and a quick drive up High Street to OSU Campus.

The space will make you feel like you're in a jeweled oasis. It's perfect for out-of-town visitors wanting to see this vibrant part of the city or locals looking for a stay-cation

The space
This listing includes two separate one bedroom apartments. An upstairs unit as well as a bottom unit. They are not internally connected and each has it's own separate private entrance. Perfect for families and friends who want to be nearby when traveling but have their own private space as well. There is an outside patio with Cornhole and backyard Jenga available for use.

name: Columbus Neil Home
description:
Absolutely no parties, loud music, or being loud outdoors. The owner lives next door and has been known to ask guests to leave without giving warnings when these things have happened in the past. We want to make sure to keep all of our guests and neighbors happy so please be courteous. The house is equipped with sound monitors in order to prevent loud or large gatherings. We appreciate your cooperation with keeping the neighborhood quiet.

This home is the perfect place to stay whether you are here for business, visiting friends and family or just to visit the city! Sleeps six in comfy queen sized beds, making it perfect for large groups or families. The home also has 2 couches that pull out into full beds allowing for extra guests. Fully equipped kitchen, living room and everything you need. Walking distance to Short North. Parks very near home.

Guest access
Guests have access to the whole home.

host_about:
We are childhood friends and business partners.
We are originally from Canton, Ohio and now reside in the Cleveland area. We both graduated from The Ohio State University and started hosting on Airbnb in 2013. We started Cleveland House Hotels, which is a short term vacation property company in 2015.  We have a full time cleaning staff and maintenance person on hand to take care of any issues.  We also have our reservations specialist, Deanna who will be the one responding to your requests.

Niko (Nick) has been in the hospitality business for many years, having worked in hotels and restaurants.  He owns a small diner in Old Brooklyn called Gus's Family Restaurant.  He is married and has two children.  In addition to cooking and owning a restaurant, Niko is the co-founder and COO of Cleveland House Hotels.  

Billy is a co-founder and CEO of Cleveland House Hotels.  Billy is a successful real estate investor and has been in the sales business for over 15 years.  He loves traveling and spending time with his son, William.

neighborhood_overview: Located north of John Glenn Columbus International Airport and approximately 15 minutes east of downtown Columbus, Easton is the premier retail center in Ohio. The center includes scores of shops, including Nordstrom’s, LL Bean, the American Girl Store, Crate & Barrel and Tiffany’s. Locally based retailers like Abercrombie & Fitch and Victoria’s Secret test new concepts here, and dining options include local favorites like Jeni’s Ice Creams, Northstar Cafe and Brio Tuscan Grille. Other amenities include a movie theater, the Funny Bone Comedy Club and several hotels, including the AAA four-diamond rated Hilton Columbus Easton. A new Easton Gateway area is home to REI and Field & Stream. Now open, LEGOLAND Discovery Center Columbus is a great place to bring the kids!

neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

The City of Columbus is focusing on creating a new Short North style neigh

Bexley’s Drexel theater provides a throw-back movie experience with a selection of independent and unique films. There is the fantastic Cherbourg bakery, Brassica Eatery, coffee shops and gourmet foods, and several fantastic ice cream and pizza shops.
host_about: We love seeing new places, experiencing the culture and meeting new people. description:
Close to everything, comfortable inside, and a great rate. This apartment is the perfect resting place for your visit to Columbus! Just 2 min to the freeway, 5 minutes to the Short North, and 8 minutes to Downtown, this is a very easy access to where you need to be. Located in the center of the improving Milo-Grogan neighborhood, this one-level apartment has been renovated with modern touches. It includes a memory foam mattress, sleeper sofa, and everything inside is brand new!

The space
This apartment is entirely on the first floor of a 2 apartment building. The upstairs apartment is vacant, and will soon be renovated as well. So our guests will have the entire building to themselves for the start of 2019.

License number
2019-1137
neighborhood_overview: Milo-Grogan is nestled in a perfect location close to the I/71 freeway, and not far at all from the Short North, or Downtown. This neighborhood is undergoing revitalization, with many homes and buildings under construction. Just under a 5 minute drive from the best coffee shop in Columbus, Fox in the Snow, and a 10 minute drive to over 50 bars and restaurants, you will be close to all the action.
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

Guest access

There are 3 grocery stores in the zone. Coffee shops, bakery’s and lots of other interesting shops nearby. Be sure to visit the Bookloft in German Village.
Surrounded by great eateries, pubs, sports attractions, and some of the best annual festivals in the Midwest. 5$ Uber ride to everything downtown. Plenty to do and see.

This amazing home features walkable distances to popular venue's such as Therman's Grill, Schmidts, Jeni's, Brown Bag, Greso's and Planks and The Book Loft. name: Guest Room in Historic German Village House
description:
Comfortable guest bedroom with shared bathroom in beautiful historic home in desirable German Village, close to downtown and Nationwide Children's Hospital. Walking distance to Schiller Park, and multiple restaurants/bars on picturesque brick streets. The large welcoming porch is a great place to sit and relax while people/dog watching. A private back patio with grill, also offers a quiet space to unwind. Inside, while historic, offers modern updates such as upgraded appliances & fixtures.

The space
I offer a spacious guest bedroom with a new Gel-Infused Green Tea Memory Foam Queen Mattress, 2 dressers, & a TV. My home is non-smoking, clean and comfortable, feel free to use the kitchen and/or washer & dryer. The bathroom is shared. Agadore (the cat) is friendly but not intrusive. I do keep the cat out of the guest room to reduce allergens.

Guest access
Guests have access to laundry room, kitchen, living room, dining room, porch & patio.
neighborhood_overview: German Village is a quiet historic neighborhood, close to downtown and easy access to many surrounding areas. Very close to Nationwide Children's Hospital & Columbus Convention Center. Great place to stay for festivals, conferences and concerts. Very walkable neighborhood with historic homes built in the late 1800 - early 1900.
host_about: Very easy going, love to entertain and garden. In addition to my flower garden I help grow tomatoes and peppers and can salsa. I am a member of the German Village Garten Club and volunteer regularly at Ronald McDonald House. Love a patio and live music!

name: Modern Midtown Ranch
description:
Cute, quaint home with an open floor plan which makes it feel very spacious. Walking distance to park as well as 5-10 minute drive from everything! Including downtown, OSU, Upper Arlington, Grandview, Hilliard, Short North and more! We are big foodies and coffee drinkers so we have plenty of near by suggestions for you as well as a huge selection of coffee and espresso drinks in our home.

The space
We do live in this space when it’s not booked out, so we will try to keep our stuff out of the way for you. Please give feedback on what would be helpful for us to pack away! If you would like firewood provided please let us know ahead of time! We can also set up the office with the queen air mattress if you let us know you need that ahead of time!

Other things to note
Please no big parties and no smoking or vaping!

name: Housepitality ~ The Maynard Manor
description:
The Maynard Manor is a bright, spacious, and exquisite home for your next visit to Columbus. Tucked in the historic Old North Columbus neighborhood, this 5 BR, 2.5 BA is just steps from High St., yet only 5 minutes from the Highway. The perfect spot for families, groups, and business travelers. Our kitchen/dinning room is perfect for a family meal, and our living room is perfect for catching up with old friends. There are 4 BR and 1BA on 2nd floor, with a spacious master suite on the 3rd floor.

The space
The Maynard Manor is fully stocked with lots of great amenities for your trip to Columbus. The kitchen comes equipped with everything needed to prepare and serve a group meal. Our living room has 2 sleeper sofas, and plenty of seating. The Manor has a large fenced in back yard, the garage is not available for guests. 2 bedrooms have a desk and chair available for use.

License number
2019-1409
neighborhood_overview: Old North Columbus is a neighborhood located just north of the Ohio State University in Columbus, Ohio. It was founded in 1847 where, at the time, it was a stand-alone city out of the confines of Columbus until it was incorporated into the City of Columbus in 1871. In its early years the city was a popular stagecoach stop with people traveling from Worthington to Columbus. Today Old North Columbus is popular for its local music and its unique "untouched architecture" which is reminiscent of its old roots.

name: The Beautiful Garden Villa, A Splendid Hidden Gem
description:
An oasis in the city that is the perfect getaway. Stand-alone structure within a 3/4 acre of private garden.  Self check-in, independent HVAC, and extraordinarily clean.  An authentic AirBNB experience curated by caring hosts in an exquisite location, surrounded by the enchanted environment and serenity.

The space
Beautiful, quiet villa nestled in a private European-inspired garden. A one-of-a-kind unique retreat located in Northwest suburb of Columbus. Centrally accessible to I-270 and SR. 315, just minutes away from shopping, dining and entertainment.

You will be staying in a 475 sqf. free-standing, custom-crafted villa, along with modern furnishing and luxury amenities designed to comfortably accommodate two adults. Your villa offers peace and tranquility among our vibrant and convenient location, with safe and free parking. It is a home away from home - a welcoming and restful ambiance to truly enjoy and relax in all seasons.

Gue

name: Historic Neighborhood | Work from Here | Washer & Dryer
description:
This listing is practicing COVID-19 sanitation practices!

Please check out the longer description below to see what cleaning procedures we have in place.

We are here for any displaced students, traveling medical professionals, or anyone seeking self-quarantine or respite from COVID-19.

Stay healthy, friends! Together we can get through this!

The space
Our COVID-19 Sanitation cleaning procedure includes:

1. Washing our hands and wearing disposable sanitary gloves or rubber cleaning gloves
2. Our cleaning solutions are at least 70% alcohol
3. Cleaning only with disposable wipes. Using cotton or microfibre otherwise.
4. Using a color safe sanitizing spray to sanitize soft surfaces such as furniture, edges of curtains and decorative pillows
5. Disinfecting all light switches, windows
6. Disinfecting the thermostat, railings, garbages, and all surfaces
7. Washing all dishes/u
neighborhood_overview: Victorian Village, which runs along Neil Avenue south of The Ohio State University and northwest of downtown Columbus, is one of central Ohio’s cores of fine residential architecture. The area is known for its Victorian houses, which were built when a streetcar line first ran along Neil Avenue around 1900.  It is an amazing neighborhood close to Downtown Columbus attractions, restaurants and events.  The Village is also home to Goodale Park, Columbus’s most popular downtown park and the annual site of the Comfest music festival plus many other events.
host_about: I. Love. Houses and Hosting! I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2013 when I used to live in New York City. I moved to Columbus, Ohio to restore homes and Host travelers full time in 2018. Rest assured our listings are put together with thought and care. Cleanliness and your comfort are our top priority. You'll love our spaces!

description:
Make yourself at home! Experience this newly renovated ~1200 sqft house/3 br/2.5 bath located just outside of historic German Village in Columbus, Ohio. Great for extended stays with friends or business trips , this contemporary setting is just minutes away from downtown Columbus, The Short North, OSU, and Nationwide Children's Hospital. It's also just a short walk to Schiller Park and other popular German Village attractions. Please contact me for further information or any inquires.

The space
Let's break it down! First off, the entire house is well lit with a lot of natural light and LED ceiling lights nearly everywhere. The living room features two relaxing sofas. The blue sofa is a futon sofa that can transition flat into a sleeper and the green sofa is full size standard sofa. A 50" Sharp smart TV rests on a full motion wall mount bracket so you can adjust the TV's position to fit your viewing preference. The entrance to the basement is throug

name: Nice home near downtown Columbus
description:

name: The Aerie
description:
A private apartment in the historical Old Town East neighborhood, a short ride away from downtown.

The space is furnished with classic charm, and is well-suited for a working holiday, with two desks & writing areas. Guests also have the use of a small kitchenette, with a sitting area.

Please be aware that the space is a walk-up, with the kitchenette on the second floor and the bed and bath on the third.

The apartment has one off-street parking space with additional street parking available.

Other things to note
The apartment is on the second and third floor, accessed by stairs.

Although this is a private space, it's in an older shared building, so please be courteous of the neighbors, and plan to observe quiet hours after 10 PM.

Licensed by the City of Columbus Department of Public Safety, License no. 20191317

Newly renovated beautiful home, with property manager on-site to take care of all guests needs immediately, and friendly outdoor cats to hangout with . Arrive whenever you like, park for free on the street, and simply tap your code at the door. It's our goal to be your second home in the city.

The space
LuxBox is a modern smart loft. You get a private bedroom with keypad door lock. This room has one full size bed. Shared spaces include kitchen, living room, full bath and half bath. Clean and modern bedroom includes premium memory foam mattress and pillows, AC/heat, hanging clothing storage, extra towels and blankets, and smart TV with an assortment of Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Video, Disney+, and HBO.

description:
Camper can be delivered to Columbus expo center or another site around Cbus.

You can also tow to any site around Columbus, Ohio and beyond. Or delivery available. Delivery fees apply.

Several camper options available. Enjoy your camping in the comforts of a RV. With Queen bed, table that converts to bed, and bunks. ac and fridge. ($40 a night site fees additional at expo).

The space
Everything you need for your camping getaway. Very clean and spacious. Queen bed, fold down sofa bed and table coverts into a bed for additional beds. Working stove, microwave, fridge, freezer, ac, gas heat, hot water. Full kitchen and bathroom.

Guest access
Camper.

Other things to note
Trailer weight. 4100lbs. 23ft length. and 2 5/16 ball size.
Also ask about our last minute availability discounts and weekdays specials.

name: The Historic Central Condo - Arena, Short North, Convention
description:
The Downtown Dreamer is the premier located condo accommodation in Columbus. Directly facing Goodale Park on its Southwest corner, its best in class location is a few minutes (250 feet to 1/2 a mile) walking distance to all of your Convention Center, Nationwide Arena District, Short North and Downtown recreational and business endeavors.

First off all, our space gets its best ratings due to its amazing location. It's truly one of the best being directly a crossed from one of the most beautiful parks in all of Columbus, Goodale Park. That being stated, it's right off 670 where it meets Goodale so it does come with a bit of street noise. Although our home is a bit older, this space comes fully furnished with all of your modern lodging accommodations including a full kitchen with a full set of dishes, cooking utensils, high end dishwasher, oven, microwave and stove top. Our living area is furnished decoratively with plenty of seating arrangements, lush leather couches, a de
neighborhood_overview: The Victorian Village is one of the most sought after neighborhoods in Columbus because of its old fashion charm and new aged entertainment options. This space gives you all of the peace of a private suburban neighborhood with all the buzz of The Short North, Arena District, Downtown and Conventional Center in just a few minutes walking.

name: The Rock House
description:
Newly renovated 4 room suite flooded with natural light in a Jazz Age Tudor home close to Bexley & Downtown Columbus. Enjoy coffee, lounging or a meal on the shared back patio overlooking sprawling gardens with unique stone landscaping. 5 min to (CMH) Airport, 7 min to Arts/Theater District, Short North & 4th St Beer Trail, 5min to Bexley's Drexel Movie Theatre dining & shopping, 15 min to OSU Stadium & Campus, 1/4 mile to Ohio Bikeway Trails access.

The space
Your private space starts in the 1st floor tiled foyer leading to a spiral staircase up to second floor office, living room with kitchenette and bedroom. Keyless entry allows for flexible check in and easy access with room to store bicycles. Kitchenette includes refrigerator, microwave, dishes & flatware, and coffee & tea. PLEASE NOTE: Please make sure you are physically able to navigate a spiral staircase to the main living area.

Guest access
The bright red door next to the drivewa
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in a half acre urban oasis, on a main city street with easy access to Bexley, Downtown Columbus, OSU Campus, Ohio Dominican College and Capital University.
host_about: My wife Pam and I have lived in Columbus for over 30 years. Pam practiced law and I worked in the theater as a stagehand and business agent. We are hiking enthusiasts, love live music and travel. Pam is a top notch gardener and I played lead guitar for the James Gang.

name: Victorian Downtown home in Olde Towne East
description:
Due to the Coronavirus virus and all guests safety I take this virus very seriously. There will be extra cleaning between every guest. All surfaces will be disinfected with bleach. All linens washed and put into the dryer on the highest level of heat. I want your friends and family to feel safe while staying here. Don’t miss this opportunity to stay in this old Victorian only 5 mins to downtown Columbus. It is a 10 min Uber ride to the convention center and 15 Min Uber ride to OSU.

The space
This bnb has all the historic details of an old Victorian with exposed brick and ornate fireplace but also has all the modern amenities with smart TVs, stainless appliances, central air conditioning and washer/dryer. As you approach this massive house you will be greeted with a sweeping front porch where you can sit and enjoy everything urban living has to offer. As you enter the house the open concept will connect you with the whole family. The living space is open
neighborhood_overview: This old house is located on a beautiful historic street with many other magnificent Victorian homes.  It is a mile away from downtown town Columbus and the streets are lined with sidewalks easy to take a stroller through this beautiful neighborhood.  There are many parks close by to explore and enjoy.

name: ★King’s Landing Duplex close to OSU/Short North ★
description:
This Game of Thrones themed 1,000 square foot duplex boasts brand new furnishings and outstanding amenities. 15% off stays of seven nights or more.

Enjoy your fenced in backyard, complete with grill and patio seating. Inside the house, you’ll find a fully equipped kitchen, combined washer/dryer, and an adjustable bed and Smart TV in each bedroom.

Located within easy walking distance of OSU’s campus. 5 minutes to the Short North and downtown Columbus, and 10 minutes to the Airport.

The space
•Fenced in backyard, great for pets. Contains patio seating, a grill, and a court for playing bocce ball
•Fully equipped kitchen with granite counters and stainless steel appliances.
•Off-street parking behind house on gravel drive. Free on-street parking available at all hours
•Smart TVs with access to any of your streaming subscriptions and complementary Sling TV service.
•Combined washer/dryer

Guest access
Gue
neighborhood_overview: Living in Weinland Park offers residents an urban feel and convenience with the benefit of private fenced yards and a small community vibe.  Residents tend to be young professionals.  There are ample bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks, as well as sidewalks with quick access to running trails.  Weinland Park is a development success story.  The area is designated as an opportunity zone, helping to spur the revitalization of the historic neighborhood.
host_about:
I’m a moderately geeky real estate investor who prefers to be outdoors and is an avid hiker, fisher, runner and explorer. 

I live in one of my favorite places, Columbus, Ohio.  I provide fun, affordable, high end, safe and memorable vacation homes and event venues in and around the city.  I take pride in my properties and always respond to guests' needs.

I love great food and cocktails and am full of suggestions for fulfilling local experiences.  

I love to travel.  A few of my favorite destinations include Barcelona, Jaipur, Paris, Santorini, Athens, London, and Manhattan Montana.

I love animals.  I own cats and grew up with dogs.   I design my homes to be pet friendly.  I would love to meet your pets.

name: Housepitality ~ The Traveler's Townhouse
description:
This urban townhome is clean, basic, and affordable! Less than 10 minutes from downtown, this townhome is in the South of Main neighborhood. Our neighborhood is one in transition, but still has many boarded houses and a bit rough around the edges (so it may not be for everyone). Our space has a brand new kitchen and bathroom. This small space is great for 1 - 4 people (though up to 6 can fit with the air mattress). We welcome all travelers to your home away from home, the Travelers Townhouse.

The space
Our space is just one block off of Main Street, and is a somewhat quiet street. There are neighbors in close proximity, and can sometimes be heard from inside our apartment. The space has a large living room, with TV. Dinning room, and kitchen. The kitchen is stocked with dishes and cooking basics. Upstairs are 2 bedrooms, and bathroom. One large bedroom has a queen bed, memory foam mattress, and desk. The smaller bedroom has a queen bed and memory foam mattress. O
neighborhood_overview: The South Of Main area is near Downtown, Children's Hospital, Olde Towne East, and German Village. We are a short drive to many great locations around the city, but there are not many within close walking distance. There is a Family Dollar store about a block from our house, and a great daytime sandwich shop, but our immediate area is one some people may not feel safe walking in at night. However you could get to most top destinations in Columbus with less than $10 in an Uber.
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!
