name: Fast Wifi | Extremely Walkable | Sanitized
description:
This cozy apartment is the perfect location in the historic neighborhood, The Short North with a vintage vibe and loads of character. 3-minutes walking distance to many restaurants, cafe's, & shops -many of which are doing take out! Dogs permitted on case by case basis. Notify us before booking. $20/per dog/per night

**There construction throughout building Jan. 2021-May 2021**

Convention Center:0.9 mi
Nationwide Arena & Express Live: 1.4mi
OSU: 2.2 mi
North Market: 1 mi
Schottenstein Center:2.9 mi

The space
Our COVID-19 Sanitation cleaning procedure includes:

1. Washing our hands and wearing disposable sanitary gloves or rubber cleaning gloves
2. Our cleaning solutions are at least 70% alcohol
3. Cleaning only with disposable wipes. Using cotton or microfibre otherwise.
4. Using a color safe sanitizing spray to sanitize soft surfaces such as furniture, edges of curtains and deco
neighborhood_overview:
Art, food, drinks, shopping, spas, salons, live music, and festivals - the Short North has it all. The Short North Arts District is a vibrant, exciting urban neighborhood with plenty of local flavor and culture!

You’ll be staying in an amazing location. Bars, dance clubs, and restaurants are just down the street. You will hear noise outside during the day at at night.
host_about: I. Love. Houses and Hosting! I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2013 when I used to live in New York City. I moved to Columbus, Ohio to restore homes and Host travelers full time in 2018. Rest assured our listings are put together with thought and care. Cleanliness and your comfort are our top priority. You'll love our spaces!

name: Perfect Location Steps from High St w/ Parking!
description:
Our apartment offers 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, full kitchen, and private parking in the heart of Victorian Village just 1/3 mile from High Street and the Short North! Close enough to enjoy everything on High Street but just far enough to enjoy the neighborhood feel of Victorian Village! You are less than a mile south from OSU Campus, less than a mile north from the Columbus Convention Center, and 1/3 mile from all of the best bars and restaurants Columbus has to offer!

The space
Our house offers 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, full kitchen, and 1 private parking spot in the heart of Victorian Village. The common space has a sofa, TV w/ cable & wifi, and a desk for workspace. We also offer an air mattress for your convenience. The house has been newly furnished with all furnishings. The kitchen has all major appliances, coffee maker, and table with seating for 4.

Guest access
You are able to access the entire place.

License number<
neighborhood_overview: Victorian Village, which runs along Neil Avenue south of The Ohio State University and northwest of downtown Columbus, is one of central Ohio’s cores of fine residential architecture. The area is known for its Victorian houses, which were built when a streetcar line first ran along Neil Avenue around 1900. Victorian Village is directly west of the well known Short North area of Columbus. Some of the most celebrated spots to eat and drink in Columbus are in the Short North Arts District, which is gaining recognition as a dining destination. This portion of High Street is filled with boutiques, art galleries, coffee houses, restaurants, and bars.

name: Quaint gem in the heart of a vibrant hip community
description:
Decor is a warm toned shabby chic/--but leaning away from overtly 'pretty'. Leather chaise-longe couch, laminate/hardwood flooring. Round dining table in muted distressed brown/grey, with mismatched suede dining seats. Kitchen is brand new, in brown with reddish tones. Full size bed, in private room with locks.. New Bathroom. Lots of people walk to parks, restaurants, and community events in this charming village vibe, that supports local retailers.

Guest access
Living, dining, kitchen, bathroom and allocated bedroom.

License number
2019-2592
neighborhood_overview: Close walk to Schiller Park--a dog lovers dream. Very big community vibe. A plethora of truly great restaurants from $--$$$. A couple of favorites are Lindeys/Barcelona/German Village coffee shop (unbelievable character and super cheap!). Visit the book loft, St Marys newly renovated Church, and the wine shop on 3rd.
host_about: Enigmatic and intrepid traveller. Citizen of 3 Countries. Delights in learning about others journeys, interests, hobbies. Enjoying the explosion of great eateries and craft breweries in Columbus. I have travelled extensively world-wide, with two of my favorite experiences being a 7 day sailing holiday throughout the Greek Islands, and walking the el' Camino de Santiago. I have several beloved authors, two of which are Ken Follet, and Bryce Courtney. I have a wide assortment of friends of differing ages and backgrounds. I am a dog lover, but don't have one at this minute. I've run 5 marathons, and aspire to qualify for Boston. You will be welcomed with conversation, or space, as you desire.

name: Huge 4 BR 1.5  BA house in Heart of Downtown
description:
Updated historic townhome in the heart of downtown Columbus. This is a very spacious, cozy, and clean property, great for large groups! 4 bedrooms, 1 parking space and free street parking, and 1.5 bathrooms. We can accommodate up to 12 guests. Just down the street from Downtown Columbus and the historic Old Town East and Topiary Park. Brand new flooring, amenities, and always freshly cleaned sheets and towels. Wifi, coffee, laundry supplies all included. Very spacious and comfortable townhome!

The space
This newly renovated townhouse is great for large groups of guests or the couples getaway! We are right down the street from the beautiful Topiary Garden, a short walk to Olde Towne East and Downtown Columbus, and we are a short ride to OSU and the Short North. The interior of the property will bring you back to a historical time period of Columbus with great history!

The first floor consists of a living room with comfortable couch and HD TV, full kitc
neighborhood_overview: The Old Towne East is the eastern district of downtown Columbus. Within Old Towne East are buildings of culture, art, design, and education. Columbus Metropolitan Library and the Columbus Museum of Art are both located within the district. Also, there are numerous educational options within this district. Located in the district are the Columbus College of Art and Design, which was founded in 1879 as the Columbus Art School and enrolls roughly 1,300 students, and the Capital University Law School. The area allows for easy accessibility to everything Columbus has to offer including the Arena District, German Village, Short North, Crew Stadium, and is 10 minutes from Port Columbus International Airport.
host_about: Husband and father.

name: Beautiful Historic Home in German Village Area
description:
Beautiful historic home in desirable German Village area, close to downtown and Nationwide Children's Hospital. Guest bedroom used for Airbnb, master bedroom is locked off. Walking distance to Schiller Park, and multiple restaurants/bars on picturesque brick streets. The large welcoming porch is a great place to sit and relax while people watching. A private back patio with grill, also offers a quiet space. Inside, while historic, offers modern updates such as upgraded appliances & fixtures.

The space
The bedroom has a newer Gel-Infused Green Tea Memory Foam Queen Mattress, dresser, & a TV. My home is non-smoking, clean and comfortable, feel free to use the kitchen and/or washer & dryer. Agadore (the cat) is friendly but not intrusive. Please be aware that while I will not be home during your stay, this is my primary residence and my bedroom is locked off. There are personal items in the home (refrigerator & bathroom) but I want my guest to feel at home while v
neighborhood_overview: German Village is a quiet historic neighborhood, close to downtown and easy access to many surrounding areas. Very close to Nationwide Children's Hospital & Columbus Convention Center. Great place to stay for local festivals, conferences and concerts. Very walkable neighborhood with friendly neighbors and something to do around every corner. The architecture is beautiful, most homes built in the late 1800 - early 1900.
host_about: Very easy going, love to entertain and garden. In addition to my flower garden I help grow tomatoes and peppers and can salsa. I am a member of the German Village Garten Club and volunteer regularly at Ronald McDonald House. Love a patio and live music!

name: Lovely Lower Level within our home
description:
There is not a private entrance but once you enter through the front door, you’ll have the whole lower level to yourself.
We live in a quiet neighborhood close to a metro park with lots of hiking/biking trails. And there’s easy freeway access. We're 10 minutes from Polaris Fashion Place, 10 minutes from uptown Westerville and 15 minutes from Easton Town Center.

License number
2019-2043
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood was built in 1970 and there are still a number of original owners who love it here. There is pride of ownership and a sense of community.
host_about:
I'm a work-from-home life and marriage coach. My husband is a professional counselor. We are in love with our first grandchild but we'll try not to show you pictures! I love traveling, great food, the great outdoors, learning, live music and meeting new people! 
I enjoy a good conversation over a glass of wine. As hosts, we are friendly but will give you all the space you need.

name: Regan's Place: (Very Near Downtown)
description:
I live in a charming 1910 Queen Anne's house which is just over a mile and a half from the heart of Downtown and 5-10 minute walk to local eating establishments. My house is easily accessible to convention centers, as well as the Museum of Art, Topiary Garden, Ohio Theater, and more!
Key will either be in the mail box, door will be unlocked or I'll be home. THE LOCK BOX IS JAMMED.

No locals please.

License Number: 2019-1829

The space
My home is full of charm. A lot of people enjoy looking at the art. I have two separate listings, each has a twin bed.

My other listing: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/8578379?location=columbus%2C%20ohio&adults=1&check_in=2019-06-25&check_out=2019-06-26&source_impression_id=p3_1560796699_QANOk52ea2pt4kN6

Guest access
You can access the bedroom and bathroom. If you want to use the kitchen, please request ahead of time.

Other things to note
My hom
neighborhood_overview:
My neighborhood was at one place the homes of James Thurber and the Robber Barons of old. It is gorgeous with a variety of old homes--Queen Anne, Victorian--and tree lined streets. It is experiencing a renaissance and offers a tavern (very good food!), a diner where you can enjoy a good breakfast, a pizza shop that's a cut above the chain pizza's, and a new vegan cafe.
These restaurants are a 5-10 minute minute walk from the house.
host_about: I am a friendly person who enjoys getting to know others.  I love to read, work in the yard, sing, sing, sing and snuggle with my dog--when he let's me. I love tea, love Italy and enjoyed Ireland and enjoy movies shown at art cinemas. I don't watch much television but when I do it's usually PBS. I don't smoke.  I really enjoy travelling and have been on package tours and well as trips where I hunt out hostels.  I appreciate having different people around!

name: Big Grey-Short North 4BR-3.5B 2800sqft RoweRentals
description:
This is a new custom home in historic Victorian Village, Short North. Experience the comforts of home and still be close to the Short North & OSU!

The space
This custom home is located just 1.6 miles from the Convention Center and 1.9 miles from OSU. No parties or events allowed.

Nearby:
Columbus Convention Center- 1.6 mi
OSU Stadium- 1.9 mi
Downtown- all areas within 2.2 mi
Ohio Expo/ Fairground/Mapfre Stadium- 1.7 mi
Schottenstein Center- 2.4 mi
Easton Mall- 6.6 mi

PLEASE NOTE:
• We do not host guests that reside in the Columbus area.

Additional Guest & Fees
There is an additional guest fee per person/night for the 3rd guest and up. When entering the correct guest count into the reservation or inquiry this will be automatically calculated. Registered, paying overnight guests are only permitted at the residence. We receive active notifications from exterior video cameras- and we strictly
neighborhood_overview:
The Short North Arts District is one of the Midwest’s best kept secrets. There is a huge variety of unique shops, bars and restaurants, and art galleries along High Street and a number of annual events that take place year-round. We have a thorough list of recommendations in the house to local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants.
The Short North is made up of several historic neighborhoods; this home is located in Victorian Village Village.

IS THE NEIGHBORHOOD SAFE?
We live nearby and feel the neighborhood is relatively safe, but it can be a bit intimidating if you are not use to city living. Please note this is the city- we do have petty crime in the Short North and University area, and always advise to practice not leaving valuables in your car (we have not had any issues at our apartments, I state this because we are in the city) and walk with a buddy at night on well-lit, busy roads such as High Street, Summit, and 5th Ave.

Near the following:
•
host_about:
We met in Japan, moved to Columbus in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and have been loving it ever since! We are both experienced travelers (25+ countries on 5 continents between us) & are passionate about renovating historic homes and building new homes. Check out our (Hidden by Airbnb) s at @RoweRentals and @RoweHouseCbus.

We love being hosts- providing a comfortable home to travelers who are visiting our gem of a city- 'Cbus'! We know quite a lot about Short North entertainment & restaurants- there is so much to do here, feel free to ask!
- Ingrid, Mike, and Frances, Co-Host 

Our life motto- Live like someone left the gate open!

name: 1st Floor Southern Orchard  Apartment!!!
description:
Completely remodeled and fully furnished Southern Orchard duplex near downtown and the Children's Hospital. The building was just giving a modern remodel, inside and out, with all new granite countertops, new flooring and all new appliances.

This fully furnished Southern Orchard apartment has 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom which allows you to sleep up to 6 people comfortably.

The apartment is on the first floor and another tenant stays in the other apartment on the second floor.

The space
The one story apartment boast plenty of private and common area space for all to enjoy!

REMINDER: The owners have a ZERO TOLERANCE for parties. The home is in a residential neighborhood and parties are not permitted. The owners have authorized the neighbors to immediately call the police if a party is taking place.

FYI the City's 5.1% Occupancy Tax is included in the cleaning fee. We do not charge you additional fees for taxes.
neighborhood_overview: Our house is centrally located and just a short drive to the Children's Hospital, German Village, Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Garden, Scioto Audubon Metro Park, Lou Berliner Sports Park, Columbus Museum of Art and downtown Columbus Getting to The Ohio State University Stadium is just a 15 minute drive.
host_about:
I'm an easy-going owner and take pride in all things I do. I will always do my best to make sure my guests' stays are seamless so that you can enjoy everything that Lake Tahoe & Columbus have to offer! 

I'm an avid Cavs, Indians, Browns and Buckeye fan and have lived in several states. If I'm not inside watching my teams you'll find me at the beach, on the water or skiing new mountains!

name: 🌟 Updated Grandview Townhome!-Central Downtown/OSU
description:
FULL BED REMOVED. Only 2 queens. Sleeps 4.
• Walkable to Grandview attractions!
• 1.5 miles to downtown/OSU campus
• Off-street parking
• Premium linens, towels, & soaps!
• Spacious bedrooms for 4 to sleep comfortably w/2queen beds, & 1 cozy couch
• Fully stocked & modernized kitchen w/granite counters & stainless steel appliances
• Large dining table for shared meals or work
• HD TVs w/cable & Netflix in all rooms
• Complimentary coffee
• Washer & dryer w/detergent
• Like-home feel!

The space
When you enter the home, you will walk into an open living and dining room setup that houses some cozy couches facing a brand new 65” TV and a cute dining table nestled under a dimmable light to set the mood however you like. As you enter the kitchen you will see a brand new experience with granite countertops, tile backsplash, stainless steel appliances and dish and cook ware for your use. While in the kitchen, you
neighborhood_overview: This walkable, bikeable neighborhood, a short 1.5 miles from downtown Columbus and it’s major highways, is one of Columbus’ most coveted areas. A hybrid of urban flair and neighborhood warmth, Grandview’s vibes are at the same time laid-back and buzzing with energy. Stroll the wide, tree-lined sidewalks of Grandview Ave amid the hum of cafe-table chatter. Discover specialized independent shops, curated New-York style boutiques, a chocolatier’s gorgeous handmade truffles, independent breweries, top-rated coffee roasters, cutting-edge salons, and of course, world-class restaurants that use fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. The electric mix of restaurants here have consistently been recognized by critics and diners alike for their cuisine, ambience, and outstanding attention to detail. Grandview is also home to a collection of award-winning craft microbreweries and taprooms. A hub of creative culture and out-of-the-ordinary experiences, Grandview offers an array of guided food and drink
host_about:
Hello, my name is Joe - I was born and raised in Ohio and love Airbnb which means you’ll receive high service and quality, local recommendations to make the most of your trip. Feel free to instantly book or message me, I’m happy to answer any specific questions in advance.

By day, I’m a consultant. 
By night, I’m a friends/family man and an Ohio sports junkie. 

I’m a well traveled Airbnb guest and have pulled a lot of inspiration from other properties so I know what great hosts should do to create a comfortable guest experience. Be sure to ask me about a few of my favorite things on our welcome sheet.

Make yourself at home!

Newly renovated 2,000 SF home (4 BR/2.5 Bath) in Harrison West. Ideally located for everything Columbus has to offer - 1.8 miles to Ohio Stadium, 8 minute walk to the lively Short North, and 1.5 miles from concert venues, Clippers & Bluejackets games in the Arena District.

Large outdoor patio area and 2- car garage

Very open space ideal for entertaining for 16+ guests. Dynamic outdoor patio area complete with outdoor dining, covered lounge area, and stainless steel grill for outdoor meals and activities. Living room has plenty of seating with high-speed Wifi and Roku access, and the dining area that seats 6. The kitchen area has granite counter-tops, stainless steel appliance and an assortment of spices and basic cooking ingredients for large family-sized meals. We

name: Ruby in the Village | The gem of downtown CBUS 💎
description:
Ruby in the Village is a historic, two-story townhome located in Italian Village within minutes of Columbus' best restaurants, coffee shops and attractions.

Short North / High St: 0.3 miles
Ohio Stadium: 2.4 miles
Convention Center: 1 mile
Nationwide Arena: 1.6 miles

The red exterior makes it easy to spot, but the real treat is inside its walls. Exposed brick, tall ceilings and high end details will provide the perfect place to relax during your stay in this beautiful and thriving city.

The space
We've given this home so much love and have purposely furnished it with some of our favorite personal items--we hope they make you happy as well!

The living room is bright and cozy with exposed brick, a Roku TV (meaning no cable, but all the apps to sign in yourself!) and a CB2 sleeper sofa.

The kitchen is stocked with pots/pans, silverware, dishes--all the basics and then some. You'll find a Nespresso machine w
neighborhood_overview: We've lived within one mile of this area for over 10 years, and couldn't be more in love with its charm, history and growth. Columbus is home to incredible restaurants, coffee shops and bakeries.
host_about: I’m Jacqui and live with my husband and young daughter in Columbus, Ohio. We love new people and new adventures, and believe so strongly in treating all people with respect. See more about the space we care so much about on insta, @rubyinthevillage.

name: ♥ Stylish Private Room ♥ Close to Columbus Airport
description:
Enjoy the beautifully designed house for your stay in Columbus OH! A stunning 5-star room, tailored to perfection, filled with some excellent design and decor. Enjoy a state-of-the-art Smart TV in the living room while you lounge in your new suburban home. It’s the ideal room retreat in a unique home, located to the east of the center of Columbus – 5-minute drive to Port Columbus Airport. Get ready to get inspired!

The space
This spacious, ideally located property offers a stay beyond your imagination. Facilitating several places to relax and your very own private room to seclude yourself. The quiet surroundings will easily make for a relaxing stay. Considering the location and facilities of the home we host lots of couples and solo travellers. This wonderful apartment has a spacious shared living room, a shared open kitchen and a bedroom fit for kings and queens. It also suits friends looking for a nice location. Comfortable and spacious, yet located convenientl
neighborhood_overview:
We are located to the east of Columbus. With lots of great eateries at a convenient distance such as:
• Scotty’s Cafe
• Cherbourg Bakery
• Rubino’s Pizza
• Jeni’s Splendid Ice Creams
• Stav’s Diner
• Brassica

Minutes to Columbus John Glenn Airport, 5 minutes to Easton Shopping Center, 10 minutes to Expo Center, 15 minutes to The Ohio State University/Downtown/Short North.

A little more inwards you will find Columbus’ Near East Side; an up-and-coming destination just east of downtown Columbus, beyond the Columbus Museum of Art. This collection of neighborhoods, which includes Olde Towne East, the King-Lincoln District, and Franklin Park, is an up-and-coming area full of stately Victorian homes and leafy streets. Olde Towne East is host to interesting clusters of dining and nightlife along Parsons Avenue and Oak Street. On Parsons, grab a coffee at Upper Cup, enjoy farm-fresh produce at Black Creek Bistro and music and drinks at
host_about:
Hello! 

We are Dane and Alicia (DNA), we both are world travelers with a passion for real estate and hospitality, based in Columbus OH! Considering a deep-rooted passion for anything to do with hospitality and facilitating great customer experiences, Airbnb is the perfect thing to do! 

Not only do we love being Airbnb hosts, but we also love being on the traveling spectrum too. Have traveled a lot and am now doing more overseas travel!

We really enjoy the ability to share the experience of living in this wonderful house. Definitely check with us for amazing must visit locations, where to go for superb walks and wonderful experiences in Columbus! We love meeting new people from different walks of life, but as a host, we give my guests all the space they want.

Looking forward to hosting you soon,

Dane & Alicia

name: Glen Echo Hideaway-Newly Renovated Studio Apt
description:
Entire space has been renovated & everything is new! Comfortable & QUIET studio apartment on a QUIET street which is conveniently located near a major highway (I-71), OSU/Ohio State University (1.1 m), Mapfre Stadium (1.4 m), Ohio Expo Center & State Fairgrounds (2.1 m) & downtown Columbus (4.8 m). Bus stop is within 300 feet of our home & minutes to OSU & downtown.

The space
Clean, completely private & separate from our living space. The unit is attached to our home so you may hear some noise. Safe & quiet neighborhood, plenty of private parking. Enjoy our backyard, or sip your favorite beverage on the back porch.

We do have a small dog, he is friendly & loves people, however, he does use the backyard. Please be sure to keep the gate closed at all times.

Guest access
Guests have their own private kitchenette, bathroom with large shower, a comfortable queen bed & small sitting area. There is a Smart TV which has access to Amazon,
neighborhood_overview: The beautiful Glen Echo Ravine is a short walk from our home. It is a great park for bird watching, leisurely, quiet strolls & picnicking, far away from the street noise of the busy city above.
host_about: I’m a stay at home mom of two busy girls. I run a tight ship at home but love spending as much time as I can with my family.

name: Housepitality ~ The Friendship House - Location!!
description:
Our charming Victorian house is the perfect spot to stay on your trip to Columbus! Enjoy an amazing location, better located than most hotels. Steps from the Short North and Italian Village, and a few minutes from Downtown Columbus. The king master suite has lots of space to spread out, and a bathroom to die for! Large kitchen for gathering and enjoying meals. Fenced in back yard for your pets. Come and make your memories at our house!

The space
The grand first floor has soaring ceilings, and an inviting space to enjoy. A large kitchen/dinning room, living room, and a bedroom with full bed, and twin daybed. Also on the first floor is a half bath, and laundry room. Upstairs is a master suite with a king bed and memory foam mattress. The master bath is huge, with a soak tub, and shower.

Guest access
Guest will have access to all of the house, but not the garage.

Other things to note
We have 2 parking passes for the stre
neighborhood_overview: Our home is nestled in the beautiful neighborhood called Italian Village. Just north of downtown  Columbus, and also a short walk to the Short North. We love this historic and quaint neighborhood!
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

name: Cozy SOHUD Second Floor Apartment With Parking Lot
description:
This is a one bedroom unit, with fresh paint and new carpet in the Bedroom. There is a queen size bed, nightstand, desk, and small closet. There is a spacious bathroom, new shower only, (no bathtub). Clean fresh linens, and some basic necessities, hair dryer, etc. The kitchen is basic with stove, refrigerator, and microwave. All kitchenware is supplied and some basic cooking items provided. Coffeemaker. The living room has couch, chair tables and TV with local antennae, amazon stick.

The space
Great location, some new fresh updates. Close to many venues like Mapfre Stadium, OSU, Hospitals, Short North, and Downtown. Awesome for weekend events like Blue Jackets and concerts. Also convenient for short-term stays. One thing to note is that the thermostat for this house is not located in this unit. We do provide window air conditioning units in the summer and room heaters in the winter. **Exterior security cameras are present for security**

Other thin

The neighborhood is safe, unique, and close to many restaurants, taverns, etc.

CMH Airport - 7.8 mile drive

Hello!

Talk to you soon,
Matt

name: Bold + Artistic | Downtown Views @ 1br w/ Balcony
description:
COVID-19 PRECAUTIONS
Nothing is more important to the us than the health and safety of our communities. We are monitoring the situation very closely, and we would like to share the additional precautions that have been recently added. All amenities at this property have been closed. We have increased our cleaning standards, specifically as it relates to cleaning and disinfecting surfaces. This is all very necessary for the safety of guests, and we must do our part to keep this community safe.

The space
STAYING LONG TERM? Contact us for up to 25% off your stay!

We have a zero-tolerance policy for parties or gatherings. We use a noise sensor to detect the noise level inside the suite, a people counter which counts the number of people nearby, in addition to numerous neighbors who are understandably more sensitive during this time. The guest amount on your reservation must match the number of guests that will be inside the suite at any given time. We
neighborhood_overview: This quiet community of galleries, event spaces, art studios, nightlife, and old factory buildings shows the history of Columbus. The COSI museum, National Veterans Memorial and Museum, Genoa Park and Scioto River is only a 10 minute walk. If you crave the city life, downtown is only minutes away across the bridge. There is much to see and appreciate on the west side of river.
host_about: Frontdesk offers trusted travelers exactly the stay they want - their kind of place, in their kind of neighborhood.

name: CAT CONDO  // 4k tv | minifridge | patio | wifi //
description:
• Condo in Columbus right by freeways 270, 71, and 161.
• 10 minute drive to CMH airport
• Safe Neighborhood + parking
• Short drive to Otterbein, Easton/Polaris malls, & downtown Columbus.
• Husband and wife in our early 30s & our two tuxedo cats.

1 private bedroom with flat screen TV, mini fridge and door that locks from the inside. 1 private guest bathroom with shower/tub combo, drawer space, hair dryer + toiletries.

No weapons of any kind allowed, even with license
420-Friendly :)

The space
We are located in a corner unit on the golf course. This is for aesthetic purposes only, as our home ownership does not automatically qualify us for use of the golf course for golfing. There is a walking path that residents are allowed to use. We are a 30 second walk from the pool, and our spacious backyard view is beautiful. We just renovated our house in 2018 with updated eco-friendly appliances, new windows and blinds
neighborhood_overview: Small community of families of all ages tucked away in Westerville. Quaint and quiet, yet still social. Lots of dogs in the area. Private walking path on property through the woods, as well as a "take a book/leave a book" library stand. Free, well-lit parking directly out front.
host_about:
I am outgoing and can find something to relate to in everyone. I have a dark sense of humor and am difficult to offend. I am interested in art, politics, rap music, psychology, and philosophy.

"Birds born in a cage think flying is an illness."

name: Hip Italian Village Townhome w/Parking
description:
Modern chic private two story condominium within walking distance to all of the amenities on High St. in the heart of Italian Village. One block to coffee shops, restaurants and breweries. 1 Mile to Convention Center. On-street permit parking included. This home was built in 1900 and has been exclusively updated and renovated keeping the original charm.

The space
One large bedroom on the second floor with a king bed. Second daybed (trundle) is in the loft area and converts from twin to a king-size bed. This condominium is 2 blocks from the hustle and exciting night life in the short north on High Street, but tucked away from the noise and traffic. Across the street is a small retail center for an evening cocktail or coffee. The beds are comfy with luxurious linens. The kitchen comes fully equipped with a Keurig and all appliances to make your stay feel like you're at home. The second bedroom is an open loft in the 2nd floor. Included is a room divid
neighborhood_overview: This quiet back street is perfect for relaxing after a night on the town. Fox in the Snow Coffee shop is one block away along with Cosecha Cocina and Hoof Hearted Brewery.
host_about: I'm originally from the east coast!  Transplanted to Ohio over 30 years ago.  Love animals, water, old homes and things that go fast, ie two wheels.  I'm a Real estate broker/owner in Columbus and Tampa and home renovator!

This cozy apartment is the perfect location in a historic neighborhood with a vintage vibe and loads of character. 3-minutes walking distance to many restaurants, cafe's, & shops -many of which are doing take out! Dogs allowed on case by case basis. Fees start at $20/dog/night. Notify us prior to booking.

The space
Our COVID-19 Sanitation cleaning procedure includes:

1. Washing our hands and wearing disposable sanitary gloves or rubber cleaning gloves
2. Our cleaning solutions are at least 70% alcohol
3. Cleaning only with disposable wipes. Using cotton or microfibre otherwise.
4. Using a color safe sanitizing spray to sanitize soft surfaces such as furniture, edges of curtains and decorative pil
neighborhood_overview: Art, food, drinks, shopping, spas, salons, live music, and festivals - the Short North has it all. The Short North Arts District is a vibrant, exciting urban neighborhood with plenty of local flavor and culture!
host_about: I. Love. Houses and Hosting! I’ve been an Airbnb host since 2013 when I used to live in New York City. I moved to Columbus, Ohio to restore homes and Host travelers full time in 2018. Rest assured our listings are put together with thought and care. Cleanliness and your comfort are our top priority. You'll love our spaces!

name: Eli’s College place
description:
Just a typical college apartment with a free room that I’m renting out. The apartment is located on Ohio state’s north campus. Very close to the Mapfre stadium which hosts the local club soccer team and many Columbus events. Great and cheap place to stay if you and a friend are visiting Columbus or Ohio state and want a chill environment to be surrounded by!

FIRST TIME USING AIRBNB? USE MY CODE FOR A DISCOUNT OFF YOUR FIRST RESERVATION
https://abnb.me/e/LMRuDKuVdX

The space
Living room is open to all guests as a lounge area. Make yourself a home!

Other things to note
Use this code if your a first time user for a discount! https://abnb.me/e/LMRuDKuVdX

You need a parking pass to park in the main parking lot of the apartment, but there is free parking on the west side of the apartments that I can direct you to. So do not park in the main parking lot unless you wanted to be towed!
I have posted pictures of WHE

Currently I am a first year pharmacy student at The Ohio State University. 
I attended the same university while obtaining my undergraduate degree in addition  playing  football there. I went on to sign a free agency contract with the Tennessee Titans, but was cut and now I’m just pursuing my doctorate in pharmacy!

name: Rare Downtown Apartment with Free Parking
description:
A unique, deeply cleaned, apartment in Downtown Columbus, with a spacious living room that boasts a brand new 4K flat screen television in a theatre-seated environment that seats up to 25 people. Get a great night’s sleep in a secluded bedroom with a brand new memory foam mattress, black out curtains, and iMac setup that empowers the weekend warrior.

The space
Located downtown on the corner of Mound and High street. Perfect location for Red White and Boom, events happening at The Westin Hotel, The Southern Theatre, Ohio Theatre, Columbus Commons, and Nationwide Conference Center. Also a great way to attend College Football, Hockey, Soccer, and major music events while staying outside of the traffic and commotion.

When you walk into the apartment, you may notice the corner stage that has been signed by hundreds of people. The living room seats up to 25 guests and was once used as a concert space for touring jazz and blues artists around the world.
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is situated in a quiet part of High Street in Downtown Columbus. Within a block, you'll find an Irish Pub, Wine, Coffee, and Chocolate Shop,  Barbeque  Restaurant, Tapas Restaurant, and Hotel Restaurant. There's a European suit store directly below the apartment. Two blocks walk in either direction leads you to more restaurants, bars, arcades, and downtown parks and patios surrounded by office buildings.
host_about:
During college, I spent two years on the road as a musician all around the US and Europe. Throughout my travels, I founded a few businesses and non-profits and made Columbus my home. I’m also currently a Senior Management Consultant. I travel internationally for technology projects, speak at conferences, and add cultural elements to city transformation initiatives.

As a host, I enjoy creating the kind of environment that I would want to have for myself as a traveler — a place that’s modern, comfortable, equipped with new and working amenities, and in the heart of downtown, near bars, restaurants, theaters, and conferences, yet still restful and peaceful.

Completely remodeled and fully furnished Southern Orchard duplex near downtown and the Children's Hospital. The building was just giving a modern remodel, inside and out, with all new granite countertops, new flooring and all new appliances.

This fully furnished Southern Orchard apartment has 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom which allows you to sleep up to 6 people comfortably.

I'm an avid Cavs, Indians, Browns and Buckeye fan and have lived in several states. If I'm not inside watching my teams you'll find me at the beach, on the water or skiing new mountains!

name: The Easton Hideaway
description:
Within minutes from Easton Town center, this cozy 3 bedroom 2 bath home gives you the luxury of country-style living and a plethora of restaurants, shopping and entertainment that Easton has to offer. Slip away and relax in a tree shaded backyard where you can sit and enjoy the peaceful sounds of Mother Nature. You will fall in love with this fully furnished home that includes all the comforts of home as well as an outside seating area and gas BBQ for your use and enjoyment.

The space
Enjoy the convenience of being less then 10 minutes from Easton!! This cozy yet spacious space, close to everything Columbus, Gahanna, and New Albany and all other areas have to offer. This private home provides a flat-screen smart tv, with wifi throughout. Washer, Dryer and Dishwasher are included. Coffee and tea are provided. Large master suite features a queen sized bed with a private bathroom and huge walk-in closet. One other bedroom offers a queen bed as well while the thi
neighborhood_overview: Located north of John Glenn Columbus International Airport and approximately 15 minutes east of downtown Columbus, Easton is the premier retail center in Ohio. The center includes scores of shops, including Nordstrom’s, LL Bean, the American Girl Store, Crate & Barrel and Tiffany’s. Locally based retailers like Abercrombie & Fitch and Victoria’s Secret test new concepts here, and dining options include local favorites like Jeni’s Ice Creams, Northstar Cafe and Brio Tuscan Grille. Other amenities include a movie theater, the Funny Bone Comedy Club and several hotels, including the AAA four-diamond rated Hilton Columbus Easton. A new Easton Gateway area is home to REI and Field & Stream. Now open, LEGOLAND Discovery Center Columbus is a great place to bring the kids!
host_about: I am a wife and a mom and a business woman who loves to travel and see new places. I grew up in California and live in Ohio with my son and my husband. We currently have 2 properties that are listed on airbnb in Columbus, Ohio, and we plan on adding more in the coming years.  We have lived in Columbus since 2012, and own our own home in the Bradywine area.

name: The Brick Townhouse | Walk to OSU & Arts District
description:
You’ll love the location and character of this updated vintage brick townhouse, just steps to the vibrant Short North Arts District! Walk everywhere for the weekend: less than 5 minutes on foot to great dining and nightlife (Condado, North High Brewing, The Table, Paulie Gee's Pizza, Kroger grocery store). Walk a little more to Ohio State (15 mins to the south end of campus), or down High St to the Convention Center (25 mins).

The space
You'll arrive and be able to park two cars end-to-end in the driveway alongside the building. From there, use the keypad lock to let yourself into the building. The first floor is the living space, with a living room with a large couch (sleeps 1, but you will need to bring your own sheets/pillows/blanket if someone will be sleeping on the couch). The eat-in kitchen features a large peninsula counter top with space to sit and socialize and is stocked with basic amenities (cookware, dishes, etc.) and a Keurig coffee maker. We p
neighborhood_overview: The "Dennison Place" neighborhood of Columbus is the best area for a traveler who wants to experience the vibrancy of the Short North Arts District (we're at the northern end of the district), the grandeur of Victorian Village architecture (to the southwest), and yet still be a quick walk (25-minutes or less) to The Ohio State University and Columbus Convention Center / downtown.
host_about:
Hi, we're Kate and Nat!  We live here in the "Short North" neighborhood of Columbus, near the properties that we manage.

We are both graduates of The Ohio State University - Go Bucks!  Kate is a physical therapist and Nat has a background in IT & management consulting.  We love being Airbnb hosts and hearing about all the exciting reasons that people travel to Columbus!

The Ohio State University: 2mi

The space
Our COVID-19 Sanitation cleaning procedure includes:

1. Washing our hands and wearing disposable sanitary gloves or rubber cleaning gloves
2. Our cleaning solutions are at least 70% alcohol
3. Cleaning only with disposable wipes. Using cotton or microfibre otherwise.
4. Using a color safe sanitizing spray to sanitize soft surfaces such as furniture, edges of curtains and decorative pillows
5. Disinfecting all light switches, windows
6. Disinfecting the thermostat, railings, garbages, and all surf
neighborhood_overview:
Grandview Heights is an amazing and lively neighborhood.

There is a Starbucks on the corner of the block, just a 2-minute walk away.

There are several local restaurants, bars, and shops walking distance. We have a list of our favorites on-site should you need recommendations. You must check out Grandview Avenue while you're here! Complete with sidewalk cafes, local coffee, and plenty of unique shopping!

The OSU campus and Ohio Stadium are a quick Uber or drive away as is downtown Columbus.

description:
COVID-19 PRECAUTIONS
Nothing is more important to the us than the health and safety of our communities. The guest amount on your reservation must match the number of guests that will be inside the suite at any given time. We

name: Live on High Street~Short North w/parking
description:
If you want to be within walking distance of anything and everything this is the bnb for you. This 1 Bedroom, 1 Bath condo has a great back deck and is located on High Street in the Short North. It has private parking options in the back on Pearl which is hard to come by in this area. It is a 8 minute walk to the Convention Center, a 15 minute walk to Nationwide Arena, 2 min walk to Goodale Park, and a 5 minute uber from OSU campus, German Village, and Nationwide Children's Hospital.

The space
This apartment is perfect for business, families, and anyone looking to enjoy the city of Columbus in absolute style. It has private off street parking options in the back that are first come first serve. The back deck area is really quite nice to have 6 months out of the year. The unit is fully equipped with a washer/dryer, fridge, microwave, oven, and coffee brewer. The bedroom is very large and contains one Queen memory foam bed with a large closet with shelving for all
neighborhood_overview: The Short North is the place to be if your coming to Columbus for literally anything. EVERYTHING is within walking distance of my home. The airport is also only an 8 minute uber.
host_about: I am from Springfield, OH and went to college at OSU where I traveled abroad in Barcelona. I moved to Chicago for a couple years and got some corporate experience in a fun city. I then moved back to Columbus where I live currently in the Short North with my beautiful fiancée. I help run my family's coffee and vending business, called Sheehan Brothers. I love traveling, golfing, eating and most importantly The Buckeyes!!

Perfectly located within walking distance to popular restaurants such as Lindy’s and Barcelona, multiple bars, coffee shops and eclectic stops. neighborhood_overview: German Village is the home of Schmidt’s with German food at its finest.  Features are their very own sausages and sauerkraut.  Shops in the area make browsing fun!  Or there’s Katzinger’s, the local deli where you choose your own homemade pickle right from the barrell!  Lindy’s, a very popular dining destination is 2 blocks away and be sure to make reservations.  One of the largest, privately owned book stores in the country featuring 32 rooms is in the heart of German Village.  The Book Loft is a great place to spend an afternoon with a coffee shop right next door.  The beautifully redesigned Columbus Library is close and worth the stop.

name: Crestview
description:
Beautiful three bedroom home located in Clintonville, a beautiful, residential neighborhood in Columbus, Ohio. Just North of Ohio State Stadium. Near all main highways and very easy access downtown via the highway or the boulevard. Walking distance to many shops, bars and restaurants. Perfect for families, large groups, or business groups. Fully furnished with everything you may need. Free Wifi. Linens and towels are provided. Sofa couch pulls out into full size bed! Convenient street parking!

Absolutely no parties, loud music, or being loud outdoors. The owner lives next door and has been known to ask guests to leave without giving warnings when these things have happened in the past. We want to make sure to keep all of our guests and neighbors happy so please be courteous. The house is equipped with sound monitors in order to prevent loud or large gatherings. We appreciate your cooperation with keeping the neighborhood quiet.

The space
Pets are WELCO
host_about:
We are childhood friends and business partners.
We are originally from Canton, Ohio and now reside in the Cleveland area. We both graduated from The Ohio State University and started hosting on Airbnb in 2013. We started Cleveland House Hotels, which is a short term vacation property company in 2015.  We have a full time cleaning staff and maintenance person on hand to take care of any issues.  We also have our reservations specialist, Deanna who will be the one responding to your requests.

Niko (Nick) has been in the hospitality business for many years, having worked in hotels and restaurants.  He owns a small diner in Old Brooklyn called Gus's Family Restaurant.  He is married and has two children.  In addition to cooking and owning a restaurant, Niko is the co-founder and COO of Cleveland House Hotels.  

Billy is a co-founder and CEO of Cleveland House Hotels.  Billy is a successful real estate investor and has been in the sales business for over 15 years.  He loves traveling and spending time with his son, William.

name: Low-Key, Quiet Neighborhood, Lots of Space!
description:
See a virtual tour on Instagram: @TheBrickManor 🏡
●Two-story townhouse with 1100 square feet. Easy SmartLock check in/out.
●Free, easy street parking in front of the building.
●Located in the historic Berwick neighborhood, next door to Bexley & Capital University, close to shops, restaurants & coffee shops.
●10 minutes to Downtown Columbus & Nationwide Children's Hospital, 12 minutes to the Arena District.
●"The location was perfect and the space was remarkable. It was truly a dream home!"

The space
Living Room
●Comfy Bassett sofa and lounge chairs + bright reading nook.
●50" flat Roku Smart TV with access to Netflix, Hulu, and other TV apps. There is no antenna or cable.

Kitchen + Dining
●Stocked with everything you need to make a meal, along with a Keurig coffee maker, regular coffee maker & coffee/tea bar (there is no complimentary breakfast). There is no dishwasher.

Bedrooms
●Both bedrooms h
neighborhood_overview:
Berwick is a historic, low-key neighborhood, minutes from downtown. There's easy freeway access and lots of nearby restaurants, coffee shops and bars.

Bexley's Main Street, located five minutes from the apartment by car, is a good place to start, with a Starbucks, bookstore and several cafes and ice cream shops. See a list of our recommendations onsite or check out our guidebook.

OSU, the Blue Jackets arena, COSI, Easton Town Center and more are a quick Uber or drive away.
host_about: We're former expats and Peace Corps volunteers, who together have lived on six continents, including a ten-year stint in Bangkok, Thailand. After exploring the world together, we returned to our hometown of Columbus, amazed at how our city had blossomed in the time we were away. We're proud of everything the "heart of Ohio" offers and enjoy sharing it—and our welcoming space—with visitors.

name: Downtown Loft Oasis
description:
A completely furnished 1 bedroom loft apartment in the middle of downtown Columbus with a full kitchen, full bathroom, dining room, living room, walk-in closet, private balcony, and access to the shared rooftop deck and lounge.

The space
Located in the middle of downtown Columbus Ohio, the Carlyles Watch building offers loft style condos, apartments, and rentals. The Downtown Loft Oasis is a short term rental offered here. The building is at the corner of Third and Gay streets and is conveniently in the active Gay Street district. The building offers secured entry and 24/7 video security on the ground floor. Additionally, there is a shared rooftop deck and lounge with downtown views that are unmatched.

Guest access
This is an entire condo rental. You will not be sharing the condo with any other guests. This rental also includes access to the shared rooftop lounge and deck.

name: 1BD Olde Town East Guesthouse Near Downtown
description:
Our guesthouse is a spacious 1 bedroom/1 bath with outdoor living spaces in the heart of Olde Town East just 1 mile from Downtown Columbus. Located in a quiet neighborhood filled with hip restaurants and great bars, this home is the perfect place to stay while working, visiting, or exploring Columbus. The 3 room guesthouse has been completely updated with a new bathroom and our signature "most comfortable beds in Columbus" mattress.

The space
Our guesthouse is perfect for the work traveler visiting Columbus by themselves, a couple visiting town, or a small group of people looking for a budget friendly option. With excellent accessibility to all Columbus has to offer, our space has a queen bed and TV in the bedroom and a futon, air mattress, and TV in the living room. The guesthouse has dedicated WIFI. We also offer a walk-in shower and work space for your convenience. Our one-story guesthouse has a private entrance, free street parking, and a private patio
neighborhood_overview: We are a 1 mile drive to downtown, 10 minutes to THE Ohio Stadium, 10 minutes to the Columbus Convention Center, 1 mile to Children's Nationwide Hospital, 10 minutes to Nationwide Arena, 10 minutes to the Short North, and 10 minutes to the Columbus Airport.  Convenient to everything Columbus has to offer!
host_about: Hello, my name is Annie! My husband and I are the owners of Columbus Accent Homes! We live in Columbus with our two dogs. We love hosting in Columbus, but we also love to travel and always try to stay in Airbnbs so we get a better feel for the local scene. Interested in hosting your space in Columbus on Airbnb?  Send me a message; I'd love to help!

description:
Located in the heart of historic German Village, this charming home has off-street parking, a big private outdoor patio, eat-in kitchen, freestanding soaking tub, king bedroom, 2 living rooms w/pull out sofa beds, Smart TVs, W/D, and Wi-Fi. Just 2 blocks from beautiful Schiller Park & a stone's throw from German Village's incredible restaurants, bars, & coffee shops, you're 1/4 mile from downtown, 1 mile from Short North & near Arena, Convention Center & OSU Campus.

The space
2-story layout has twin living rooms and kitchen on main level with main bedroom upstairs. Both living rooms have pull-out sofas. The fenced-in private backyard is accessible from the back door and from the parking pad.

STRICTLY ENFORCED: ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING,
neighborhood_overview: German Village is memorable for a thousand reasons, all of which are intimately personal to the individuals fortunate to reside in or visit the neighborhood. The sense of community is palpable, the historic architecture is beautiful, and the history is visible. German Village is not easily forgotten. From walkability to a great sense of community, German Village is an incredible place to be. You feel it when you cross through the Third Street gateway or explore the parks. Millions of individual bricks were placed on top of one another to form this Village.
host_about:
I'm a professional photographer splitting my time between Columbus, Manhattan, and Barcelona. My wife and I travel all over the country and world, now with our two little boys. We're Superhosts ourselves, which make us very courteous guests and will always leave your place tidy upon our departure, just as we’d hope you’d treat our home.  

Check out our listings if you’re interested in staying at one of our properties in Columbus. From a stunning 3 bedroom Mid-century modern home in Bexley to turn of the century historic brick homes in the heart of German Village. You're covered on your next trip to Columbus whether looking for a weekend retreat, a relaxing place to call home during a business trip, attending a convention, a wedding, or in need of longer-term accommodations for your medical residency or stint as a professor at OSU!
We look forward to hosting you!

This location is just minutes to downtown Columbus, and steps from the Short North Arts District. Milo-Grogan is a historic neighborhood, in central Columbus.

This updated house offers 3 bedrooms and a bathroom upstairs, as well as kitchen dinning, living room downstairs. We offer everything your group would need to cook a meal in the kitchen. neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

The Ohio State University is only 3.2 miles down the main drag and Riverside hospital is only 1.5 miles away.

This house was recently remodeled and updated amenities inside with a great bathroom on the second floor and a lovely kitchen! The living room is a great place to spend some downtime and relax with family or friends. If you are in town for the night life or looking for great food, we are just steps away from it all!

The space
This is a newly remodeled duplex! It is very clean with great amenities and perfect for someone traveling to Columbus for work a family / group of friends traveling to see the city! It has everything you need for a comfortable stay. The bathroom and linens are always clean and stocked with shower supplies, towels, and extra linens. You also have access to a washer and dryer with Tide Detergent Pods and Dryer Sheets.

Across street from Convention Center & 1 block from Nationwide Arena. Sunny authentic urban loft in historic building w/brick walls, wood floors, big windows & tall ceilings. Lg private bedroom w/walk-in closet & lux bathroom w/whirlpool. Full kitchen. Chic living rm overlooks North Market & can sleep another guest. Extra half bath in foyer convenient for extra guest w/o going thru the private bedroom.

STRICTLY ENFORCED: NO SMOKING, NO PETS, NO PARTIES OR EVENTS. SEE HOUSE RULES.

The space
The space is approx. 900sf, setup as a traditional 1-bedroom with 1 full bathroom and 1 half bathroom. There is an entry foyer w/a half bathroom & laundry closet. Off the foyer there is an entrance to a large kitchen w/dining table & windows overlooking North Market. A hallway leads to the main living room, which has wood floors & exposed brick wall w/decorative fireplace. A private bedroom off that hallway has a full bathroom attached w/whirlpool tub/shower, plus

description:

Make yourself at home at this modern 3-story, 5 bedroom and 2 bathroom home. The house is tastefully designed with a large living room and an amazing kitchen that will seat your entire group.

The space
Welcome to your home away from home!

This beautiful, tastefully updated home will be perfect for your group's time in Columbus. The house includes:

- Kitchen: Enjoy complementary snacks, drinks, as well as premium coffee and tea in the kitchen. It also features a stove, over, stainless steel refrigerator, microwave, toaster, Keurig K-Cup coffee machine and is fully stocked with pots, pans, utensils, and paper towels.

- Living room: Kick back on a large comfortable couch with a 50” TV. Chat into
neighborhood_overview: You've picked the perfect neighborhood to stay in. It has the best of both worlds - it's just minutes away from The Ohio State University, from downtown, from Short North, the stadiums and a ton of great restaurants and eateries. At the same time, it's on a quiet street, so you can get away from the hustle and bustle and just relax when you come home. You'll love staying here!
host_about:
Hello hello!

We are Igor, Boris and Susan - friends that are happy to open up our home to host you and your group in the wonderful city of Columbus. 

A few words about us:

Igor is a financial analyst that has been working in the industry for nearly a decade.

Boris and Susan are a young, professional couple originally from Lithuania and China. 

We all love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. 

Between all of us, we've been to probably over a 100 Airbnbs over the years and have seen a range from unbelievably beautiful ones to the not-so-good ones.

We wanted to share this house with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time, especially if you have a group of people with you, and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

If you need anything, we're always just a message away, so don't hesitate to reach out at any time!

neighborhood_overview: Harrison West, a little pocket of the Short North adjacent to Victorian Village, is safe, quiet, and very walkable! host_about:

name: Bright, cozy, central 1905 duplex, coffee/tea, W/D
description:
Welcome to your home-away-from-home! Centrally located and minutes from major highways and public transit, our duplex is the perfect launch pad to anything on your to-do list for your Cbus stay. Enjoy the newly renovated first floor with refinished original hardwoods and a bright, modern but cozy feel. Whether you are here for work, leisure, or necessity you will have a comfortable place to rest with some added amenities to enjoy at home as well.

The space
Self check in via key code at the front door. Street parking is usually available right in front of the house, but if not, is just steps away. The front porch has a bistro table for two and a cozy feel for outdoor drinks or dining.

On the first floor, you have a living room with Roku TV on which Netflix is available to you (please use the "Airbnb" profile) in addition to any of the Roku free channels. You may use your own login to any other paid apps but please remember to log off! The next room is
neighborhood_overview: This is a diverse and central area, walking distance or a brief drive away from historic neighborhoods Merion and German Village. We are conveniently right off of Parsons Ave, so you may experience some, though infrequent, noise filtering in off the main road. Since we are off of a major street, exercise basic precautions such as locking your car and bringing valuables inside with you. We have never had safety issues for our house, and our neighbors watch out for each other, but it does not hurt to be prudent in a semi-urban area!
host_about: I’m a pediatric genetic counselor and love my work, as well as seeing new cities from a local’s perspective. I speak French and love learning about different languages and cultures. I enjoy reading, writing, jigsaw and crossword puzzles, and a nice cup of coffee in the morning. My husband, Jacob, and my cat, Pearl, are my crew.

Please note-price increases for each additional guest. As you know, when you have multiple people showering, brushing teeth and flushing toilets, more water is used.
Each room in the property is cleaned and SANITIZED after each guest checks out. There is a coin operated washer and dryer guests may use. In the summer, enjoy the outdoor spaces in front or back yards.

name: Cozy, clean, and quiet; easy access to everything!
description:
This unassuming, cozy, and clean cottage is in a serene neighborhood north of downtown in the Clintonville/Beechwold/Worthington area. You'll be a short drive from most of what Columbus has to offer: Ohio State University campus, Short North, Columbus Zoo, Arena District, Mapfre Stadium, Polaris shopping district, IKEA, and so much more. The location is convenient to the Olentangy Bike trail and COTA bus service.

It's a perfect home base within easy reach of the best of Columbus!

The space
The house and garage are fully available for your use!

Parking is on site or on street.

Access: Via keyless deadbolt on the front door.

Living room: Includes a pull-out full-size sofa and smart TV.

Kitchen: Electric oven, refrigerator, microwave, Keurig. All the essentials- table ware, cooking utensils, etc.

Bath: Full bath contains tub/shower.

Bedrooms: One bedroom with a queen bed and the o
neighborhood_overview:
You'll be staying in the Sharon Heights neighborhood - which is in Sharon Township, a very clean and quiet community, full of friendly residents who will probably smile and wave if you pass them.

You will conveniently be just north of a shopping area that contains a large Target (with Starbucks) and Kroger (grocery) stores, and several fast food locations (Noodles & Co., BIBIBOP, Bob Evans, Raising Canes, and more!)

Within walking distance, just up on the main street (High Street, which runs north thru Worthington into Delaware and south thru the Ohio State Campus and into downtown), you can catch several bus lines. There are also great Greek, BBQ, and Vietnamese restaurants in that area of High Street.
host_about: My husband Earl and I find ourselves with more time to explore places we've never been now that our two kids are (mostly) on their own.  Our travels and experiences have lead us to try hosting, too.  We've had great AirBNB experiences and strive to be the kind of hosts (when hosting) and guests (when traveling) that you are hoping for!

name: Modern & Large ❤️ 10 Bed / 4 Bath | Host 26 Guests
description:
Make yourself at home at this beautiful 3-story, 10 bedroom / 4 bathroom duplex that can host 26 guests. Modernly updated, creatively designed, each 5-bed/2-bath side has its own private entrance, a living room and kitchen.

The house is tastefully designed with two large living rooms and two amazing kitchens that will seat nearly your entire group.

Every bedroom is unique and features high end furniture and a comfortable mattress that will make you feel like you're sleeping in a luxury hotel.

The space
Welcome to your home away from home!

This beautiful, tastefully updated home will be perfect for your group's time in Columbus. The house includes:

- Kitchen: Enjoy complementary snacks, drinks, as well as premium coffee and tea in the kitchen. It also features a stove, over, stainless steel refrigerator, microwave, toaster, Keurig K-Cup coffee machine and is fully stocked with pots, pans, utensils, and paper towels. The
neighborhood_overview: You've picked the perfect neighborhood to stay in. It has the best of both worlds - it's just minutes away from The Ohio State University, from downtown, from Short North, the stadiums and a ton of great restaurants and eateries. At the same time, it's on a quiet street, so you can get away from the hustle and bustle and just relax when you come home. You'll love staying here!
host_about:
Hello hello!

We are Igor, Boris and Susan - friends that are happy to open up our home to host you and your group in the wonderful city of Columbus. 

A few words about us:

Igor is a financial analyst that has been working in the industry for nearly a decade.

Boris and Susan are a young, professional couple originally from Lithuania and China. 

We all love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. 

Between all of us, we've been to probably over a 100 Airbnbs over the years and have seen a range from unbelievably beautiful ones to the not-so-good ones.

We wanted to share this house with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time, especially if you have a group of people with you, and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

If you need anything, we're always just a message away, so don't hesitate to reach out at any time!

name: Quaint gem 2 bed heart of a vibrant hip community
description:
Decor is a warm toned shabby chic/--but leaning away from overtly 'pretty'. Leather chaise-longe couch, laminate/hardwood flooring. Round dining table in muted distressed brown/grey, with mismatched suede dining seats. Kitchen is brand new, in brown with reddish tones. Two bedrooms available. One has Full bed, the other, Cali King. New Bathroom. Lots of people walk to parks, restaurants, and community events in this charming village vibe, that supports local retailers.

License number
2019-2592
neighborhood_overview: Close walk to Schiller Park--a dog lovers dream. Very big community vibe. A plethora of truly great restaurants from $--$$$. A couple of favorites are Lindeys/Barcelona/German Village coffee shop (unbelievable character and super cheap!). Visit the book loft, St Marys newly renovated Church, and the wine shop on 3rd.
host_about: Enigmatic and intrepid traveller. Citizen of 3 Countries. Delights in learning about others journeys, interests, hobbies. Enjoying the explosion of great eateries and craft breweries in Columbus. I have travelled extensively world-wide, with two of my favorite experiences being a 7 day sailing holiday throughout the Greek Islands, and walking the el' Camino de Santiago. I have several beloved authors, two of which are Ken Follet, and Bryce Courtney. I have a wide assortment of friends of differing ages and backgrounds. I am a dog lover, but don't have one at this minute. I've run 5 marathons, and aspire to qualify for Boston. You will be welcomed with conversation, or space, as you desire.

host_about:
Hello hello!

We are Igor, Boris and Susan - friends that are happy to open up our home to host you and your group in the wonderful city of Columbus. 

A few words about us:

Igor is a financial analyst that has been working in the industry for nearly a decade.

Boris and Susan are a young, professional couple originally from Lithuania and China. 

We all love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. 

Between all of us, we've been to probably over a 100 Airbnbs over the years and have seen a range from unbelievably beautiful ones to the not-so-good ones.

We wanted to share this house with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time, especially if you have a group of people with you, and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful, cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

If you need anything, we're always just a message away, so don't hesitate to reach out at any time!

Thank you for all the good reviews as well as the not-so-good ones. Your honesty is very much appreciated.

The space
The house is freshly painted/newly furnished and can easily accommodate both small and large groups.

On the third floor are one (1) huge bedroom and one (1) full

The area was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1997. The name Glen Echo refers to Glen Echo Ravine, which runs along the northern edge of the neighborhood.

name: Housepitality ~ Franklinton Manor - Spacious!
description:
Your group will find plenty of space, and something for everyone at our spacious house The Franklinton Manor. In the heart of Franklinton, this house is in the perfect location to easily access Downtown Columbus (5 min drive), OSU (12 min drive), or any other part of Columbus area. After a long day of exploring Columbus, share a meal with your group in the kitchen dinning room, or enjoy a movie in the living room. The fenced yard makes this perfect to bring your furry friends along!

The space
First floor or our house is complete with spacious living room, game room, quiet room, and a dinning room/kitchen combo room. The kids (at heart) will love the foosball table, and game collection. The quiet room is great for reading/meditation! 3 spacious bedrooms upstairs with 1 king, and 2 queen beds (all memory foam mattresses!). Large back deck and fenced yard!

The Franklinton Manor is great for:
~ Larger groups or families traveling and exploring Columb
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood Franklinton is situated just west of Downtown Columbus, and is full of historic homes. This neighborhood has experienced many phases through out it's existence, and is currently in a revitalization phase. There are lots of properties being renovated, and some that still remain boarded and empty. This area has experienced some crime in the past, but has improved in recent years.

Franklinton has experienced several great floods in the past, and has been somewhat neglected throughout the middle to late part of the 1900's. The Franklinton Floodwall, completed in 2004, is 7 miles long, cost $134 million. The wall's completion has released the area from being considered a floodplain, as well as releasing the previous building restrictions that often prevented development in the past. As a result, commercial and industrial activities are starting to grow in the Franklinton Area.

The City of Columbus is focusing on creating a new Short North style neigh
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

host_about:
Hi! My name is Kyle. My wife, Anna, and myself got married in the end of 2016. With all of our families living out of state/country, we have grown accustomed to having others staying with us over, and so finished our basement to allow others to use our space.

I grew up some in Florida and the remainder of my life here in Ohio, whole Anna spent almost her entire childhood overseas in Thailand and traveled quite a bit, so you will be able to see our love of travel when you stay here.

We have two cats, Zeke and Chloe, who are brother and sister that we rescued as kittens. They LOVE people, though sometimes play hard-to-get.

We are open books, so please do not hesitate to ask anything and everything!

neighborhood_overview: The Short North is a historic neighborhood centered on the main strip of High Street, just north of downtown Columbus. It can be described as colorful and trendy, with many art galleries, pubs, nightclubs, coffee houses, and specialty shops.
host_about:
Hello!

My name is Mitchell, and I have lived in Columbus my whole life.  I am a graduate of Ohio State's Fisher College of Business, and have worked for several local Columbus businesses.  In my free time, you might find me playing guitar or rooting on the Buckeyes and Blue Jackets.

My girlfriend and I decided to start hosting on Airbnb because it seemed like a fun and rewarding project, and a great chance to share our favorite parts of the city with new people- And we were right!  It is our commitment to you to provide a safe, clean, and comfortable home.

The Treehouse is a large home with focus on relaxation. Large windows and open spaces make for a bright, airy stay. name: Modern & Comfortable Home Near Downtown Columbus
description:
Welcome to Columbus! My home features a modern, stylish, and open concept style living space that was built a few years ago in the Franklinton neighborhood. Centrally located, the house is just a mile and a half from downtown. The thriving Franklinton Arts District is a little less than a mile away featuring breweries, galleries, and restaurants. There's also a small market within a few blocks and groceries/pharmacy in the area.

The space
The house was built three years ago and is a rare find for the area. The first house built by local architect, Jeremy A. Miller, 614 Magazine had this to say:

"(Miller's) new Franklinton home is just how he wants it: simple, open, spacious, and minimal, with high windows, higher ceilings, offering up tons of natural light. Standing atop the modish hardwood floors in the upstairs loft, you have ample view of the whole house—a kitchen dominated floor plan complete with stylized cement floors, all wrapped neatly inside
neighborhood_overview:
Franklinton is one of the hottest up and coming neighbourhoods in Columbus. The thriving East Franklinton neighbourhood, which has breweries, bars, several food options, art galleries, etc., is located about a mile away. There is a coffee shop and diner within a few blocks to help get your day started, and a small market for produce and essentials.

Overall, I have felt very safe in Franklinton. The neighbors on Cypress are great and look out for each other. However, please note this is a city neighborhood near downtown Columbus. Precaution should be taken at night and valuables should not be left in your vehicle. If you are not comfortable with this, I would not recommend staying here.

name: Housepitality ~ Lincoln Lodge II (Near Downtown!)
description:
The Lincoln Lodge II is a beautiful place for your group to stay in Columbus. Just less than 10 min from downtown, and located close to the best spots in Columbus. Our spacious condo has 4 bedrooms, 2 and 1/2 bathrooms, and is completely renovated in a beautiful modern style.

The Lincoln Lodge II is great for:
~ Larger groups or families traveling and exploring Columbus together
~ Business travelers
~ Conventions or events in Downtown Columbus
~ Sports events at OSU or in Columbus

The space
Our condo has 3 bedrooms with queen beds, and one bedroom with a single. Our kitchen is fully stocked with everything needed to cook a meal. Our back yard is fenced in. Your pets we are welcome!

Guest access
Guest will have access to the entire 4 BR townhouse.

Other things to note
This listing is for the right side of this duplex property.

License number
2019-2777
neighborhood_overview: The King-Lincoln, and Near East Side neighborhood is a thriving part of Columbus. It has many new restaurants and shops opening often and is just a few minutes drives to the best parts of Columbus. This area has a rich history of being a hub for arts and culture in Columbus. King- Lincoln is a historically African American neighborhood in Columbus, Ohio, and the site of considerable revitalization and renovation projects on behalf of the city. Originally known as Bronzeville by the residents of the community, it has been rebranded as the King-Lincoln District by Mayor Michael B. Coleman's administration in hopes of revitalizing and highlighting the historical significance of the district. The district aims to embrace its namesakes of the historic Lincoln Theatre and King Arts Complex.
host_about: I continue to be excited about Airbnb and home-sharing every day! I enjoy hosting guests, I LOVE to travel, and I really love meeting new people. I am a real estate broker that owns my own business, and I feel that my calling in life is to making spaces for people to enjoy. 5 things I can't live without are live music, friends, exploring new places, bacon, my drum set!

name: Close to OSU, Ohio stadium, and downtown Columbus.
description:
Beautiful, well-kept home in Grove City , Ohio. Centrally located to downtown Columbus, both area casinos, The Ohio State University, and convenient to local restaurants, attractions, shopping, etc.

The space
Very nice, well-kept home in a very quiet neighborhood. Beautiful area, and close to all of Columbus main attractions, and OSU. Small snacks and water offered to all guests. Guests have access to entire third floor of home, which includes two bedrooms, full bath, and loft area with seating and desk.

2019-3346

We have thoughtfully curated the house with all the amenities you could need. *We allow dogs - for a flat fee of $75. Notify us at booking.*

EARLY CHECK-IN/LATE CHECK-OUT: If you do need an early check-in or check-out please let us know at booking or as soon as possible. There is a fee of $10 for every extra hour needed.
